choices: School Party (BUGGED. Chapter appears later in list)
0.content:
Ah, good ol' Chapter Zero. This is where the spin-off storylines of Small Bargain will go...

Option 1 (School Party): The students of Opal High School throw a formal party to escape the stress of weekday work. Blake makes an attempt to make himself more appealing to Aria with his magic, but ends up shrunken to half an inch tall instead. Thus he needs to get the attention of one of the girls and think of a way to restore his size, while avoiding a dip in the snack bowl, or a swim in someone's punch.

Option 2 (Magical Mayhem): In an alternate universe, Blake goes to a school of magic and is currently the only student there who hasn't mastered spells yet. He is therefore a frequent victim of other students' hexes -- most recently, a shrinking spell.

Option 3 (Transformative Curse): Blake is cursed by his wicked pursuer, Raven Flame, and transforms into various inanimate objects (technological devices not included) for the next week. Blake must try to psychically get a girl's attention in his transformed state or endure his fate as gum, food, etc.

Option 4 (Spectral Sickness): Aria is stricken with a supernatural illness, and Blake must venture into the underworld to find a cure for his love interest's ailment, while dealing with the wrath of Raven and the trials set by Lord Samedi, ruler of the underworld.

So...take your pick, dear reader!
0.title: Alternative Storylines

choices: Aria Gleam, an elemental mage (and his crush!)
Jade, his younger sister who had more magic experience
Nora Comet, an expert witch and Blake's bully!
02.content:
In an alternate universe, parallel to the one where Small Bargain takes place, there exists a school of magic -- Opal Academy -- where spells and hexes are regular things, not unlike how the real world often experiences changing weather, tense debates, and coffee shortages. Everybody at Opal Academy is naturally gifted in the mystical arts.

Well...everybody but one.

Blake Heart nervously ruffled his black hair as he walked through the hallways of the school building. The teenage boy had recently been enrolled at Opal Academy to learn the magic required for self-defense. Unfortunately, he had yet to get the hang of his powers. Blake would often face bullying in the form of elemental assaults, speech-altering curses, unbearable itchiness, etc.

Taking a deep breath, he approached a classroom door and opened it...only for a bucket of mysterious fluid to be dumped all over him! Struggling to get the strange stuff off of his skin, Blake saw his surroundings gradually grow bigger...and bigger...no...he was SHRINKING! The bucket must have been filled with a size-changing concoction! Thankfully, he stopped shrinking at half an inch in size.

The tiny, bespectacled newbie heard footsteps approaching and retreated behind one of the nearest desk's legs. Peeking over from behind the desk, Blake was able to see the towering form of...
02.title: Yes, alternate universes are a thing.

choices: Scale Aria’s seat, then her body
021.content:
Peering up, Blake blushed a scarlet color as he saw the towering, beautiful form of Aria Gleam, his crush. She looked amazing with her brown hair, blue eyes, yellow shirt, golden skirt, and yellow flats...but it was her intelligence and gentle personality that really had the inexperienced mage smitten with her. And she had natural magical talent to boot! No wonder so many students at Opal Academy envied her.

Aria stepped into the classroom, confused at the presence of a fallen bucket and the orange fluid that had spilled from it. Not knowing the effects of this concoction, the brunette ignored it and strolled over to her desk towards the front of the classroom.

Despite his fears and insecurities, Blake decided that now was his chance to get Aria’s attention, and possibly find a way to restore his size. But how exactly did he plan to do so?
021.title: Opal Academy’s Prodigy

choices: Ms. Solar noticed her now-tiny student.
Ms. Solar is unable to hear Blake.
022.content:
It was his teacher, Ms. Feina Solar. He had to be lucky if she was here. 'Maybe I can ask her to help me.' Blake thought hopefully and went towards his giant teacher. "Ms. Solar! Down here!" Blake shouted as loud as his tiny could.

What happens next?

0221.content: The gentle teacher paused for a moment, hearing a faint noise. It sounded familiar to her, but where was it coming from? She looked around her, spotting nobody until she looked towards her feet. There, in front of her, was the now-incredibly tiny Blake,who smiled with hope in his eyes...

The teacher knelled to get a closer look at the source of the noise. "Blake?" She asked, causing the tiny boy to nod. "Yeah, it's me." He said. Feina slightly gasped in shock and immediately picked him up, placing Blake in the middle of her palm and brought her student closer to her face. "Why are you this tiny? Actually, HOW did you become this tiny?" She asked.

"I don't know." Blake said. "I don't know how I shrunk or why." Feina nodded and stroked her chin in deep thought. It was obvious the boy needed help, but class was going to start soon. "Blake, I'm going to have to hide you for now. I want to help, but you need a safe place to be in when class starts." She said. Blake nodded in understanding as the two thought.

Where should Blake be hidden?

Upon hearing Blake was a bit conflicted on one hand he would be safe and get to spend the whole afternoon with his favorite teacher, on the other hand he did sorta miss his mom and sister, then again it would just be one day.

The area surrounding Blake was quite wet and humid. His thoughts were nearly drowned out by Ms. Solar's breathing and the tongue he was lying on was smily and hard to keep a hold on. Looking in front of him was her large dangling uvula and deep dark throat that lay below him. Blake hoped to God he didn't get swallowed for whatever reason....

As class was starting to pour into the room, Ms. Solar realized she needed to talk during that and couldn't have Blake on top of her tongue while she was supposed by teaching. But she also didn't want him exposed and getting both of them into trouble. She had to think fast.


What does she decide to do to avoid getting caught?

0221121.content:
*GULP*

Without warning, Blake is suddenly swallowed by Ms. Solar. The walls of the esophagus press against him as he's moved down into the stomach. After a while, he lands with a splash in the stomach acids. Fortunately the acids aren't strong enough to harm him, so Blake goes to a nearby corner of the stomach to sit down and wait.

It feels like hours pass as Blake sits calmly as Ms. Solar teaches her class outside. Her voice echoes in a muffled manner as she's speaking and the walls of the belly jiggle ever slightly at points. Blake could stay in her forever if he wanted, but he had other things to do

Blake was now faced with two options. He could either sit and wait until Ms. Solar had a chance to privately get him back out or he could find his own way out, be it making her stomach upset or going lower into her intestines.

What does Blake decide to do?

"Well, it's not like she'll be able to hear me clearly from in here." Blake said to himself. "Might as well take some mental notes for next class." The boy sat down; he really had no real choice now, but to wait.

Turned out taking notes from inside his teacher's stomach was easier than he had originally thought. Since he was inside, Blake could hear Feina's voice quite clearly, despite all the flesh, muscle, and the boy's current height.

It seemed like hours, but Feina was finally finished with class for now. She looked at her stomach and called out, "Are you still in there, Blake?" "Yep. Still here." The boy shouted, followed by Feina sighing with relief. "Good. Now, how are we going to get you out?" She asked.

03.content:
Blake whistled as he walked his way home from another day at Opal High School, enjoying the pleasant weather. Suddenly, a strange hex rendered the boy motionless and helpless! As if things couldn't get worse, the woman responsible for Blake's paralysis slowly entered his view.

The high-schooler paled. "Raven!!"

"That's right," Raven teased, "I have you right where I want you...but, instead of killing you here and now, I want to make you suffer. For the next seven days, you will randomly and without warning transform into inanimate objects for the girls in your life to use!"

And with a snap of Raven's fingers, Blake blacked out.

...

Some time later, the boy slowly and groggily woke up from what seemed like merely a nightmare. However, he was filled with shock upon discovering that he couldn't move! Blake also noticed that he didn't have his human features...what in the world did Raven turn him into?
03.title: Transformation Troubles

choices: Yes, and she tries to help him
No, Blake is stuck for the day
031.content:
Blake found himself in total darkness, helpless and terrified. Eventually, some sort of cap was removed from on top of him, allowing the transmogrified mage to see around himself -- all 360 degrees. He felt his form being raised up toward the familiar, beautiful face of Aria, his crush, as she pursed her lips and rubbed him onto them. After a brief stint of dizziness, Blake realized that his vision had been transferred to his crush's lips...which meant...

Raven had turned him into Aria's lipstick! That conniving witch...

Though he couldn't move an inch, Blake did have another way of getting Aria's attention -- he could use telepathy! Channeling his psychic concentration, the boy sent a message into his love interest's mind: "Aria, help! It's me, Blake! I'm your lipstick!!"

Does Aria notice Blake's plight?

0311.content:
Aria paused briefly as she looked in her mirror, thinking she'd heard a familiar voice. It sounded a lot like...

"Blake?!" Aria reacted. "Is that you? What happened?"

"Aria, thank goodness you noticed me!" Blake sighed with relief. "Thing is...I'm a mage. I was cursed by a witch to transform into objects for a week, and it seems my first object was your lipstick. Please, you have to help me break the spell!"

Aria sat bewildered, not sure what to make of her classmate's plight as she stared into her reflection. Finally she spoke up:

"I...I believe you..."

"Aria..." Blake himself spoke. "I think I know how we can fix this. There might be a spellbook at my house...think you can go there and ask my sister Jade if you can borrow it?"

"I don't know, Blake...your folks are probably looking for you! Let me turn on my laptop so I can look into ways to restore you to normal..."

The brunette pulled out her laptop and turned it on. As she waited for her computer to boot up...

032.content:
Blake awoke sometime later dazed and confused. "Ugh...What the heck happened to me....Where am I?" He wondered as he tried to move from his slot, but found he couldn't! Suddenly, he felt everything around him move as a wave of light blinded him before the final face of Ruby appeared.

"Thank god I still have one piece left," she said, picking Blake up with her delicate fingers. Blake tried to scream out for help but found he couldn't speak either. Thinking about how Ruby talked to Blake, he could only assume that he had been transformed into Ruby's last piece of gum!

The cheerleader tore of Blake's wrapper and tossed him into her mouth. He landed right on her molar, facing straight up to see the other one come crashing down on him. Ruby had no clue her gum was actually a friend of hers, so she treated it like any other piece. She crushed it beneath her perfect teeth, pinned him against her cheek, and even used her finger to strecth Blake's new body out of her mouth.

As Ruby sat chewing away on Blake, she pressed him to her lips and started to blow into his body. Blakes body was pushed out of Ruby's mouth in a bubble, inflating further and further as the cheerleader minded her time. "I have to communicate with her somehow. Think Blake Think.....Wait that's it, Think!" Blake thought to himself.

As his bubbled form reached its limit, Blake thought his speech over to Ruby, "Ruby! It's me Blake, I'm your gum, Stop Blowing!!" Was all he could tell her before his body popped and stuck to her face

Ruby swore she heard something, and looking around quickly she...
032.title: Chewed by the Cheerleader

0321.content:
Getting slowly sucked back into the cheerleaders mouth, Blake could only weakly whimper mentally as her teeth chomped down on his minty body before tossing him without thought into her cheek.
"Hello?" Ruby boomed, the interior of her mouth filling with saliva as she tried to pin point where the noise came from.
"Ruby- I-" Blake began, before getting tossed onto her teeth again, "Nooo!"

Chewing happily, the unaware girl continued on her way- not seeing anyone in the deserted street. Her teeth bit down harder and harder as she felt a slight bit of paranoia enter her mind. She stopped, peeking backwards and waiting for a moment.
"I'm sure I heard someone call out to me-" She mumbled, further deafening her prisoner before slamming him to the roof of her mouth.

Beaten senseless by the now jumpy girl, Blake could only lay limp in the carnivorous mouth as it flattened out his battered body onto the bumpy roof. His groans going unheard as the powerful slimy member crushed the flavor out of him without care before tossing him into the molars. The pearly white teeth showed no remorse as they dropped like a guillotine upon him, before the tongue pushed him further in for more crushing.

The blonde sighed, finally lowering her guard as she brought the chewed out gum to her lips, it had finally lost it's flavor but was still in good shape to make a new bubble before being binned. Her heels clicked on the ground as she wandered towards the bin, her hand reaching into her purse for a tissue to spit it in, as beaten as Blake was- he knew that he would need to push himself to get her attention- this could be his last chance!

"VVVVVRRRRRRR"

Her phone vibrated with a call as soon as she touched it, throwing out it's loud ring tune with a catchy beat. Still feeling jumpy, the preppy girl recoiled, feeling her gum slid to the back of her throat. Instinctively, she swallowed, a look of panic on her face as the gum slid down her throat. She couldn't hear the mental cry of anguish as it plopped into her stomach.

Giving a little cough, Ruby answered the phone, jokingly annoyed as she explained the situation with a laugh. The social butterfly easily managed to turn a minor event into a small funny story as her 'gum' bubbled away in her acid. Blake could only cry out as he was left in the dark, his body landing on some mostly digested food.
0321.title: Decided it was nothing and kept chewing

At first, Ruby didn't see any signs that someone had called her name...but the voice she heard sounded a lot like Blake's. What did he say, he was her gum? The cheerleader spat her gum out of her mouth and waited for it to say something -- anything at all.

"Ruby!" Blake said psychically. "Thank goodness you heard me. I thought I'd be in there all day..."

"B-Blake?" Ruby whispered, grateful that the rest of the class didn't notice their surreal conversation. "How did this happen to you?"

"W-well...I'm a mage. I was placed under a curse to transform into objects for a whole week! And apparently, my first destination was your gum. Please, you have to help me!"

Ruby pondered for a moment. As gum, Blake did taste strangely good, but he was still her friend! Soon enough, the bell rang -- forcing the cheer queen to hide her gummified friend back in her mouth as she and her peers exited the classroom. When convinced that no one was looking, Ruby spat Blake out into her palm once more.

"Alright, Blake..." Ruby said at last. "I'll help you. I can't let a friend of mine be stuck as gum forever, after all..."

"Sorry Blake but you taste to good" Ruby said in a happy tone"besides this way I'll know we're you are at all times".

Blake whimpered as he was shoved back in Ruby's mouth, her molars chewing him up and down.

Ruby then blew a bubble out of Blake gummy form which expanded and then popped all over her face.

To make things worse the gum Blake had become was made so it could keep it flavor for hours on end giving Ruby no real reason to stop chewing him up.

Blake tried to psychically talk to Ruby to tell her to stop chewing him"Ruby you need to stop chewing me up, I can't take this anymore" Blake pleaded.

"Sorry Blake, but I need to have some way to keep track of you, besides you taste real good" Ruby replied to the gum boy.

"Wait!" Blake psychically yelled to Ruby,"I think I might have another way you can keep watch of me" he suggested.

Ruby replied to Blake by saying...
03221.title: "...but in the meantime, I need to hide you...

choices: She swallows the gum without a second thought.
Later, she sticks the gum to her sister’s bag.
03222.content:
“Talking to gum? I didn’t know you were that crazy, Ruby.”

The intruding voice made Ruby’s blood run cold. Blake’s would have to – if he still had blood and was not currently a blob of chewed-up gum within his friend’s hand. It was not a voice that accompanied or brought with it anything good. No, this voice belonged to a certain person who had only ever brought the pair nothing but strife.

Curling her fingers protectively around her gummified-friend, turning them into bars so as to not trap him in the dark, Ruby glanced over her shoulder with a look of pure annoyance. At the sight, she could barely repress the bile forming in her throat.

Her words slipped free in the form of a hiss. “Oh… Hello, Marcia.”

Marcia Diaz had everything a girl could possibly want. Mesmerizing brown eyes, overflowing locks of the most delicious chocolate-brown hair, supple lips oh-so inviting, smooth and creamy skin utterly free of any spots or blemishes, and a drop-dead gorgeous body that every boy at school fantasized about at the very least once. Even Blake himself had, and begrudgingly admitted to himself that it was a damn good dream.

It really said something about the genetic jackpot Marcia had won that the only girl who could possibly rival her in looks was essentially a living reflection: her identical twin sister, Maria. But that girl had no intention of ever usurping her sister’s position from her. Maria simply kept to herself. All Blake or Ruby knew about her was her leadership of the school karate club. Everything else about her was a mystery to them.

Now, one might think that anyone with enough beauty to easily bend the wills of most students and even some teachers would be content to spend her school years ruling as New Opal’s grand queen bee. But this was Marcia Diaz, and nothing was ever enough for Marcia Diaz. She wanted something more, something in particular: she wanted to be captain of the cheer squad.

So she applied. The sheer ability she displayed set her high above almost everyone else, and those judges not swayed by her athleticism fell in line with a few sweet whispers and naughty looks.

Soon, it came down to her and Ruby, equals in skill, with the coach having the final say. Clearly Marcia felt the choice was obvious. But the coach had a will of unmovable iron. Unswayed by the young enchantress' charms, the coach made Ruby, who cared for her teammates, captain over Marcia. Her first ever true loss dealt to her, Marcia’s initial dismissal of Ruby turned into a burning hatred.

As for Blake, Marcia thankfully rarely paid any attention to him. He was far beneath her in the school hierarchy; another commoner to her royalty, and as such of little interest to her. Though, occasionally he would notice her sizing him up from the corner of his eye. Maybe figuring out a way to use him to hurt Ruby.

Marcia’s trademark condescending smirk widened as she picked up on Ruby’s obvious distaste. “Hello, Ruby.” She spat back. Her eyes quickly trailed down from her nemesis’s face until they reached the gum in her hand. “I, for one, think that the New Opal High School cheer captain shouldn’t be talking to a snack. I mean, what would everyone at school think if they found out Ruby Sparks talked to gum?”

Ruby’s glare intensified. “Like they’d care, Marcia.” She turned to face Marcia head on, coming almost chest-to-chest with the slightly taller girl before her. The hand guarding her gum came to rest against her midriff, giving Blake a good view through the bars of his cage at the two girls squiring off. If looks could kill, he was sure both of them would have died a hundred times over by now.

If only he hadn’t been so absorbed in watching their dispute, maybe he would have noticed the two foreign fingers snaking in…

For an agonizing few seconds, the pair stood in the relative silence of empty classroom, their eyes drilling holes into each other’s. Then Marcia gave an exaggerated sigh of defeat. “Alright, alright...” She said with a halfhearted shrug, and began her retreat, hips swaying as she waltzed towards the door. “I’ll let you off this time, Rubes.” Stopping inside the doorframe, she glanced back at the only person now left in the room. “But if you keep trying your hardest to drag the cheer squad’s reputation into the mud, I will see to it your gone. Understood, captain?”

Ruby’s response was to simply glare back at her.

Marcia’s expression turned sinister. “And please, do try to get this into that thick skull of yours...”

A victorious smile crawled across Marcia’s face as she lifted up two fingers to Ruby. Between them sat an all-too familiar little blob. Ruby’s eyes flung open.

“Gum is meant to be chewed, not spoken to.”

The last thing Blake saw was Ruby’s shocked face before he was tossed past Marcia’s lips and into the dark, humid oppression of her mouth. Immediately, the tongue flung him across to her waiting teeth, which eagerly began to bash him and mash him between them. Chew, chew, chew. He could hear Marcia hum happily around him, seemingly enjoying his taste, and he could feel between the barrage of her teeth the slight bumps of her moving at a quick pace. What would happened to him next? He could only hope, as a flicker of light through her briefly parted lips showed him the abyss at the back of her mouth, it wouldn’t be that.
03222.title: Queen Bee, Marcia Diaz.

choices: Blake gets digested and absorbed by Marcia
By some miracle, Marcia pukes Blake out
032221.content:
After several more agonizing minutes of being chewed into a whimpering glob inside Marcia’s mouth, Blake’s fears were realized as the queen bee’s tongue tossed his gummy body into the darkness of her throat. The transformed mage boy was swallowed alive with a swift gulp.

Blake panicked as he slid down Marcia’s tight esophagus before finally falling into her hot, moist stomach with a plop. The fleshy walls pulsated steadily, and a greenish sea bubbled with acid nearby. Poor Blake tried to move, to scream for help, but he remained helpless, a prisoner of the giantess’s digestive tract.

As the snobby girl made her way to her fancy-looking home and entered her equally-elegant bedroom, Marcia stripped out of her school clothes, leaving her in only her dark blue bra and panties. She turned to her mirror and rubbed her exposed belly.

“I don’t know what it was about that gum,” Marcia mused, “but it tasted AMAZING! Hmm...no wonder Ruby was speaking to such a delicious snack!” Hands on her hips, she looked down to her tummy with a smirk. “How’s it feel in there, little gummy? Wait, what do I care, gum deserves to be digested! Enjoy becoming part of my body, sweet thing!”

Blake cried internally as Marcia taunted her snack...if only she knew she’d eaten a transmogrified human being. At the very least, she’d never resort to cannibalism...right?
032221.title: In the Belly of the Beauty

choices: The panties of a panicking Ruby.
0322213.content:
That question was irrelevant right now, as a booming gurgle from his fleshy prison so kindly remind the little blob. Right now, with Marcia’s stomach slowly stirring to live in preparation to begin processing him, the most pressing questions were A) “Would he be able to escape this?” and B) “What would happen to him if he didn’t?”

The answer to A) came all-too fast. The pulsating walls flexed, sharply and suddenly, and threw the transformed boy into the now slowly-growing pool he had only-momentarily rested beside. To the bottom, Blake’s helpless form sank, before he finally come to a stop at the base of the bubbling lagoon. Almost immediately, he felt the digestive juices start digging into him. For the first few seconds, it felt little more than an awkward tingle running across his gummy skin; then they ramped up their efforts, clearly eager to break him down, and that awkward tingle evolved into an overwhelming burning sensation.

Blake silently screamed as the acids smelted him down into nutrients for their master’s absorption. The last thing he heard before the pain overtook him was what sounded like a massive, yet muted by flesh, belch coming from the outside world. Then darkness.

It took Marcia a good moment to realize just how powerful that burp had been. It was perhaps the loudest she had ever heard, and by a long shot, the loudest she had ever herself produced. Had she’d let that behemoth loose in public, she would have been awash with utter embarrassment. But here, between herself and the goddess in the mirror, it’s strength instead blossomed a strange feeling of pride in her. A smug smirk was quick to replace the brief look of shock on her face, and once again she turned her gaze down towards the reflection of her abdomen.

“Oh! ‘Scuse me!” Marcia said with a giggle as she gave her tummy a few soft pats. Through flesh and skin, she could hear the organ diligently gurgling and churning away at the likely perpetrator of her thunderous outburst. Beneath her fingers, she even felt the faint vibrations as it sloshed and squished it’s contents.

“You really know how to surprise a girl, don’t ya?” She half-mused, half-questioned.

Glorp, went the stomach. That made Marcia laugh.

“Well, thanks for that! Always good to experience a new thing every now and then, ya know?” Again, she patted her belly in pretend-appreciation. Or was it actual appreciation? No, she thought. How can you appreciate a silly wad of gum? She shook her head slightly.

The wriggling in her stomach intensified. It was certainly an annoyance, but not enough to dampen the mood or ruin her night. Nonetheless, it would be best if he ceased his useless struggling. Deciding to have a conversation with him, she excused herself to the restroom, promising to return posthaste.

Shutting the restroom door behind her, she checked the entirety of the space and luckily found the room empty.

"Hey, Blake! I'm having a great time with this guy so can you please be quiet and stop squirming around?" Jade asked, though her question was delivered more in the tone and context of a statement.

"Are you kidding me?!" Blake shrieked internally. "Why would I do that? I told you, you can do this another time! I'm your older brother, this is the last thing I want to see my sister doing!"

"Maybe you should have thought about that before you decided to play around with your magic again. If you ask me, you deserve this. If you were just able to confess your feelings to Aria like a man, you wouldn't be in this situation."

Jade's scathing remarks eviscerated Blake's self-esteem. A dreary mood overtook him, rendering him speechless for a moment. Jade took that moment to capitalize on her dialogue.

"Tanner confessed his feelings to me and asked me out months ago without hesitation, but you'd rather practice your magic, without thinking of how it hurts others. Maybe if you had more courage and consideration, you'd be on a date with Aria, instead of trapped in my stomach."

"Look, I'm sorry okay?" Blake responded, his voice a shaky sobbing mess, though the tears could not fall. "I'll confess to her the next chance I get, and I'll stop practicing magic, I swear. Just give me a second chance!"

"If you want a second chance, then don't say a word for the rest of my date." She commanded, her voice far more firm than when she was in Tanner's presence. "I don't want to feel any annoying squirms. I don't want to hear a peep out of you until the date is over, okay?"

"Okay..." Blake replied, his voice weakening.

"Good, because if you ruin this for me..." Jade slammed her open hand into her stomach with moderate force, "You'll be trapped in my stomach forever and you'll never speak to Aria again."

"Okay, okay..." Blake whimpered the word repeatedly.

"Now, I'm going to get back to my date. Remember what I said. No talking and no squirming."

Her words were met with silence, to which she smiled. Finally, she would have the peace she desired and she could focus on her love for Tanner, rather than the protests of her annoying brother.

She made her way back into the theater, weaving through the seats until she took her rightful chair - the one next to Tanner's - once more.

"Took awhile," He remarked, grabbing a handful of popcorn. "I thought you were gonna make it quick."

"Sorry about that babe." She whispered, "But I'm feeling much better now." She nabbed a few pieces of popcorn herself, enjoying the flavor and gulping it down to where Blake resided. She felt no squirms coming from him. She beamed even wider, releasing a contented sigh from her seat and leaning her head against Tanner's shoulder.

Eventually, Jade's desire to be close to Tanner was too much to bear. Her heart felt on the verge of exploding. She plopped herself on his lap, snuggling against him.

"Babe, I'm trying to watch the movie." He whined.

"Is the movie more important than me?" She pouted.

For once the slick Tanner was not able to provide a sufficient comeback. He stewed in silence a moment, attempting to compile a witty riposte, but it would not come.

"Just move your head at least so I can watch." He requested.

"Sure. Anything for you." She adjusted herself to a comfortable position atop him without impeding his view. Tanner wrapped his arms around her torso, his hands resting on her stomach. Blake let out a brief yelp, and Jade knew this must be torture for him, but right now, she didn't care.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For Blake, this experience was a living nightmare. Throughout the experience, he kept thinking of Aria. She was the only thing that got him through. The worst part was when Tanner placed his hand on him unknowingly and rested it there for an hour. He had no way of communicating to him, only Jade could hear him, and she had made it clear what would happen if he caused a fuss. He tried to stifle his sobs out of fear that Jade might punish him for it.

He couldn't believe this, he was her older brother! Yet she had commanded him, and here he was acting obediently out of fear of her. This was all wrong. He shouldn't be forced to sit here for hours watching in dread as his sister was intimate with someone. The hours of his torment seemed to drag into eternity. Sometimes, Jade would turn around to kiss him. Sometimes, they would exchange dirty talk. Throughout the experience, he had to endure Tanner's hand trailing up and down her form, at times tracing themselves across her stomach, his current resting place. Just when he was about to break, the movie finally ended and Jade arose from his lap.

"That was actually a pretty awesome movie. Not that you would know." Tanner addressed Jade with laughter.

"I like you better than some stupid movie." She scowled. "So, what do you wanna do now?" She asked him.
0343111232.title: Hide Blake for the time being.

choices: The pressure is too much for Blake
03431112321.content:
"We can go to my house, my parents are out." Tanner suggested. It had been some time since it was just the two of them alone without his parents or someone else around.

Jade couldn't help but smile at her boyfriend's suggestion. Internally she felt the exact same way, it had been a while since they could be truly alone. "Okay, sounds like fun." she smiled.

"Great." Tanner said before wrapping his arms around his girlfriend's waist. Internally Blake was terrified of what the two would do all alone without any kind of adult supervision.

Earlier the pair had hinted at doing something they shouldn't at their age and it only served made Blake even more paranoid. He wanted to cry out, to scream to his sister that he wanted off the crazy ride, but knew if her broke there deal then she was going to leave him as part of her abs. Worse yet, he'd never be able to talk to Aria again.

He lost no matter what he did. It was either stick around and see something he shouldn't or try to fight and still see something he shouldn't, with the add bonus of pain and suffering on top.

Blake was so lost in his thoughts he hadn't even registered that Tanner and his sister were now on the move. By the time he did however, he knew for certain that this was going to be a long date.
______

"Told you they were out." Tanner smiled as he noticed his parent's car missing from the driveway.

"So how long do you think they'll be gone for?" Jade asked. The last thing she wanted was for them to show up and interrupt their fun.

"Knowing them... a couple of hours." Tanner shrugged before opening the front door. He flipped on the lights before tossing his keys aside. He wrapped his arms around Jade a slowly moved in for a kiss. A kiss Jade didn't hesitate to reciprocate.

Meanwhile, Blake did his best not to yelp when he felt another body pressed up against him. From the sound of things the two love birds were kissing. Internally he shuddered. He didn't need to see or hear this. All he wanted was to go home and have Jade fix him... And potentially find a way to get payback on Raven for kickstarting this.

The pair finally broke off panting as they needed air. "Why don't you head up to my room and I'll join you shortly."

"Got something planned?" Jade teased.

"You know it?" Tanner responded without missing a beat.

Jade smirked before giving him a quick peck on the lips. "I'll be waiting then."

And with that she began her trek upstairs. As she did her thoughts soon drifted to her elder brother who'd been surprisingly silent thus far. She half expected Blake to break their agreement or squirm like mad at the thought of coming back to Tanner's place for some unsupervised fun.

She gently placed a hand over her stomach and just as gently brushed against the spot which held his consciousness. All he had to do was make it through this and she'd try to help him get back to normal, but if he couldn't then she would keep her word. Blake would be staying in her abs for the rest of his life.

But now wasn't the time to think about all this stuff, it would only ruin the mood.

Jade entered Tanner's room and through herself across the bed.

This date was still on.

0351.content:
Dazed and unsure, Blake lay on the ground. His body refusing to move as he gazed up at the straps above him.
"What-" Blake attempted to speak, but nothing came out- a strange, faint smell wafted around his odd prison, something that he couldn't quite put his finger on. That's when he heard a noise from the corner of the room.

Dark black hair fell over the back of a barefooted giantess who stood with her back to the tiny Blake. Her phone quietly played music into her ears using headphones as she gazed into a mirror, adding black eyeshadow in the mirror. It was awkward to see from the leather flopped over him but he quickly managed to peg her as his friend Violet. He tried once more to yell up to her as she stood up from her chair, her skirt swaying casually as she edged away from her desk. Her uncovered eye locked onto the paralyzed Blake followed with a kind smile. Blake could only sigh in relief as she wandered towards him.

Unexpectedly, she raised her barefoot over his body when she got close, the rough sole wiggled high above as the small amount of dirt and lint refused to let go.
"Violet?" Blake choked, unable to be heard as her hands angled the straps that were draped over him to form a long tunnel upwards. He whimpered as he worked out what he was, right as the foot slid down ontop of him.

The tiny insole could only groan as the soft skin of the ball of her foot slid down face towards his lower body, his 'eye's' widening as her heel hovered in place momentarily as her hand adjusted the gladiator sandal prison. For a moment, a spark of pleasure hit the tiny boy from the wriggling toes, his embarrassment lasted for all of two seconds before the giant girl stood up- pounding his body thinner then ever with her powerful weight. He cried out silently as his friend ironed him out underfoot while she put her other shoe on, all of her weight wobbled ontop of his crushed body for a moment before slightly easing up. The slightly dustly sole twisted cruelly as Violet took her first step, rolling across his entire body before kicking off- pain shot through the abused insoles body as he tried to get his mind together during the feeling of low gravity, the feeling sadly didn't last long as he was soon flattened back onto the ground.

Violet didn't even think about her old sandals as she walked out of her room, nabbing her key on her way out.
"See you later- I'm off to work" Violet called out, wandering into the kitchen. Not noticing the cries from her sandal weakening with each step as she wandered towards the mail. Briefly glancing through the stack, she shrugged as she found nothing there for her before leaving to do her part-time job. Her shoes squeaked across the tiles as she wandered towards the back door, briefly glancing at the note to say her parents were out- followed by a short list of chores. With a small groan at the long day ahead, the shy goth grabbed her bag and headed out, locking the door behind her.
"Vi-Violet-" Blake tried to call mentally as her foot fell on him for the hundredth time.
0351.title: An insole for Violet

choices: The next day Blake is in a new form
Blake is trapped as Violet's insole awhile longer!
03511.content:
WHAM

Violet's foot pummeled the transfigured mage with her next step and the next after that. Blake was rapidly learning that Violet's sole-- which he had once considered somewhat cute (though of no comparison to Aria's), was significantly less appealing when it was bigger than he was and slamming down on his face repeatedly. And making things worse, was that Blake realized that she wasn't even doing this consciously. Every footfall, every moment of building pressure as her sole flexed and pressed down upon him, before a brief moment of respite, was nothing more than Violet's ordinary, every day footsteps. She was not stomping, running, leaping or even jogging. Something that Blake realized somewhere, deep down, and tried his absolute best to ignore that fact as long as he could, in an effort to do something. Anything.

WHAM

A difficult proposition when Violet's foot flattened down on his face in a repeating, endless, painful cycle.


For Violet's part she didn't even acknowledge Blake's continued torment at her feet. And why would she? Nobody took the time to think about the "suffering" their insoles endured at their feet. Insoles didn't have feelings, after all. Violet just kept on walking along on her paper route, quietly humming to herself, and trying to ignore the rising heat of the day.

"It's going to be a hot one. I can feel it." She murmured, as she continued striding along. Violet was not a huge fan of the heat, and she considered that if she wanted to avoid the worst of it, she would need to pick up the pace soon. As she thought this, her stride quickened. Not quite yet a jog, but faster than the leisurely walk she had been doing, unknowingly, and uncaringly putting more force and pressure into each and every step she took.


It was not something Blake was able to ignore, however. Just as he'd begun to adjust his mind to focus, her footsteps hammered down on him more forcefully, and Blake let out a silent gasp of pain. Unwillingly, he drew in the scent of her dusty foot, as Violet sped up, each new footfall causing Blake to release more exclamations of frustration or pain. He just couldn't focus! Couldn't keep his attention on building up any form of magic long enough to even attempt to make Violet. Her every step shattered it, and forced him to resume from square one! He felt the goth's toes scrunch lightly, pulling and digging into his face slightly, as Violet stopped at a crosswalk, twisting her foot mildly in boredom, and grinding her foot into Blake. And it was beginning to get worse. As Blake struggled vainly beneath his friend's foot, he began to feel something new.

The intense heat of the day was starting to cause Violet to sweat. And unfortunately for Blake, that started at her feet. She hadn't even fully noticed it yet, but already a thin sheen of perspiration was seeping through her soles and dripping onto Blake. The mage, at this point, was firmly disillusioned of his thoughts of Violet's feet being cute, and doubted he'd be able to look at them the same way for weeks after this was over, and Violet was only halfway done her route. She pressed on, her pace quickening and pressing down on Blake. Each footstep caused her soft sole to press Blake down harder, burying the transformed mage under her foot, and flattening him more and more into his new insole form.

Raven did tell me this would be over in seven days right? For an instant Blake was a little nervous. Magic was a fickle mistress and so many things could go wrong with even the best cast spells. Conditions and rules were in place, and Blake earnestly hoped that Violet wouldn't accidentally break one. He was already hitting his limit just from a walk that was less than an hour!

But after awhile, Violet completed her paper route and returned home.

"Whew! I'm glad that's over with!" She said with a chuckle, as she opened the front door, and stepped inside. She hung up her keys, and slid each of her sandals off, making a face as she felt her footwear practically slide off. "Oh man, it was worse than I thought." She said, looking directly at her insole-- directly at Blake!

"Violet! Can you hear me?!" Blake called out to her, straining with all his might to make any sort of motion that Violet might pick up on. But the goth's eyes only reflected mild embarrassment at him, as she began to move Blake back toward the ground. A sweaty imprint of Violet's foot was plastered over Blake, practically imprinting the mage with her footprint. Violet pushed her sandals back away in her room, and began to walk away, Blake staring, helplessly at the soles that had pummeled him walking away, and hoping that Raven hadn't been lying and that he'd be finding himself in a new form soon. Any new form would do, he couldn't handle that again. He knew now he was in the form of Violet's gladiator sandals and that she would absolutely use him again at the first opportunity. Blake wasn't prepared to deal with her soles a second time!

But would Blake be so fortunate?

0353221.content:
“Where am I?” Blake said to himself groggily. Wherever he was, it was too dark to see anything, and all he could hear were the faint sounds of a heart beating and someone breathing. Something was pushing into him from below, holding him up and pressing him together, and he felt himself rise a little and then fall repeatedly, in unison with that breathing. Inside of him, something sloshed about.

Utterly perplexed, Blake tried to remember what had happened to him, but his recollection of the day was foggy and muddled. He needed to find out where he was, hoping that would jog his memory, and luckily he knew the perfect spell for that. It was an old scouting spell, one that let a mage make an image of the area and people around him within his mind.

The young mage focused intently and soon felt his the picture begin to form, and he was greeted by the image of a female chest concealed in an orange collar shirt. That wasn’t much to go on, so he focused harder. The mental image expanded to reveal the whole body of the person that chest belonged to: Ms. Solar. The teacher was sitting at her desk, busy marking some papers and sipping away at a cup of coffee. Why was he Ms. Solar’s…

Then he remembered what happened to him. His concentration broke as it all flooded back, the mental picture of the woman shattering and splintering like glass in his head before dispersing at his realization. He had become Ms. Solar’s breasts after she had digested his coffee form! The skin, the nipple, the fat, the milk. He had become all of it, held firmly within her bra and forced to softy bounce with her movements.

Completely unaware of the boy’s situation, Ms. Solar finished her paperwork, and took the final chug of her coffee. As she felt it slip down her throat, she reflected on how inferior it was to her last cup. “Not nearly as good as you, Blake.” Ms. Solar said, patting her gut affectionately. She briefly wondered if he was okay in there, but she pushed it aside quickly. He could use magic, so she was sure he had a spell or two that would get him out in one piece. Maybe he was even enjoying the ride and would want to do it again! She licked her lips at the idea. “I might be getting to addicted to Blake-brand coffee!”

Telepathy wasn’t an option anymore, not to the furious Blake. There were other spells he knew, nefarious ones that the normally moral boy wouldn’t dare use, but right now he was angrier than he’d ever been at being betrayed, consumed and trapped by his teacher. Returning to normal was priority number one, and if Ms. Solar was going to stand in the way, she had to be dealt with…

You’re not allowed to come back up now… even if I do quite fancy drinking you again.” As she teased her delicious student, Ms. Solar reached over to her desk drawer to get the rest of the unmarked papers.

Her hand stopped itself just before the handle. The teacher glanced down at the unresponsive limb, perplexed, before a ghostly chill pulsed down her spine. She tried to scream, but her mouth slammed shut and refused to open. She tried to stand, but her legs refused to budge. She tried to grasp her head, to stop an invasive pain that crept up from her chest, but her hands refused, instead digging her fingers into the desk.

Ms. Solar panicked. W-what’s happening to me?! She was being overtaken by some unnatural force, as if she was being cursed… Her pupils shrunk. Blake?!

One of her possessed hands gave her a thumbs up.

Blake! Wait, please! Ms. Solar begged in her mind. She felt her consciousness growing weaker, being suppressed by the magical invader. I’m sorry about drinking you! I’ll never do it again, just please stop whatever it is you’r-

With a vengeful smirk, he grabbed the breasts tightly and began playfully squeezing.

In the darkness, Ms. Solar was in a fit of panic. She felt like she had been split in two, and each half was being held in place by some sort of net. Inside of her she felt liquid gently slosh with the rhyme of her faint movements, and behind her something loudly beat, with every thump it made sending a ghostly pulse through her. The situation, which she couldn’t remember how she got into, was wrecking her brain in confusion. “W-w-where am I?” She voicelessly cried out.

The answer she got was a pair of beasts descending on her from both sides and forcing her two pieces together. “AH!” The force and path of the assault fluctuated erratically; sometimes one side was stronger that the other, sometimes they were equal, and sometimes they’d change direction entirely, like pushing her up and letting her fall. Her mind scrambled frantically under the torture before finally she remembered how she got here. “Blake, please turn me back! I’m sorry!” She desperately pleaded. It fell on deaf ears, the attack continuing without pause. The teacher whimpered in defeat.

After a few minutes, Blake released the mounds from his grasp, letting them bounce back into their resting state. The mage was in no way satisfied punishing his teacher, but he shoved his revenge aside for now. He needed to get his real body back before the spell wore off, least he once again be trapped in the bust of his teacher, and to do that he’d need to get his spellbook!

With a readying breath, “Ms. Solar” stood up and took a step towards the classroom door. When the sound of heel clicked firmly against the floor he smiled proudly. Maybe this won’t be so hard after all… Then he took another step and harshly slammed against the chalkboard, violently slapping around his breasts. Damn high heels!

Eventually, he stumbled out into the empty corridor. Thankfully it seemed the school was pretty much deserted, and there was no one around to watch the teacher suspiciously shamble about. Hurrying as best he could with such annoying foot wear, “Ms. Solar” marched along, the determination of a mage blaring in her eyes.
035322111.title: Control Assumed

03533.content: Man, you're picky! What can Blake have been turned into then?
03533.title: More choices...again.

choices: Nora hears Blake, but will she actually help him?
Nora doesn’t hear Blake. Down the hatch!
035331.content:
By the time he regained consciousness, Blake found himself in total darkness. Understandably, the boy panicked and tried to run, but any efforts he made to move his limbs were in vain. Eventually, something in front of Blake was peeled away, allowing him to see the face he dreaded most...

He could see the girl’s dark hair, pink lips, pudgy body, purple T-shirt, and blue jean shorts. This was Nora Comet, the bully who’d made it her mission to make Blake suffer as much as possible!

“Ah, the joy of stealing lunch money...” Nora said to nobody in particular. “And what would be better than spending it on a tasty chocolate bar?”

The realization hit Blake like a truck. He’d been transformed into a chocolate bar for his worst nightmare! The mage knew that if he didn’t activate his telepathy powers right now, he’d end up in Nora’s hungry stomach for sure. Focusing his willpower, Blake sent his psychic message over.

“Nora, it’s me, Blake! I’m your chocolate bar! Don’t eat me!”

Are Blake’s prayers answered? Will Nora notice his situation?
035331.title: Chocolate..? Chocolate?! CHOCOLAAAATE!

choices: A breath mint for his mom, Claire
035332.content:
I have GOT to stop adding so many choice chapters...

What could Blake have been transformed into?
035332.title: Minty

choices: Claire doesn’t hear him and continues.
0353321.content:
Before he had the chance to piece this puzzle together, a pair of giant, feminine fingers descended upon him from both sides, trapping him in between their soft skin. They lifted him up, bringing him out the darkness that had surrounded him and into the light.

He was given him a good, if a little blurry, view of the world he had been transported to as he was taken higher. It was a kitchen. He was in a kitchen; one that looked so familiar. His mind lurched as it searched for the answer he knew was there, but the panic of his sudden transformation was still clogging his thoughts and keeping it just out of reach.

Soon, his twin escorts finally brought him to a gently halt. He turned his vision around, and was met by a face so familiar no mental haze could possibly stop him from recognizing them. “MOM?!”

His mother Claire was sitting at the kitchen table, staring down through her reading glasses at the papers before her. It was a sight Blake had seen many times going to or coming back from school, but never like this, transformed and at the mercy of her fingers. The mage realized his mind was still to distorted to let him use any magic, preventing him from contacting her in his mouthless state, so instead the watched her like a hawk.

Claire clicked her tongue as she swapped to another paper with her other hand, obviously quite tired of her work. She works herself too hard… Blake mused. Often he’d catch her overworking herself, and she didn’t seem to stop no matter how many times he or Jade would scold her for it. Normally, if he saw her in such a rundown state, he would prepare for her a nice and warm cup of coffee, something she was very appreciate of, even if drinking it meant spiting out or swallowing her favorite min-

The realization hit him like a truck. Mom kept her mints in her handbag. He looked down, to see his mother’s handbag below him on the table, it’s dark interior where the she had plucked him from.

Mom always chewed on mints when she worked. More often than not, she’d swallow them too.

Oh no. Blake mentally muttered.

As if on queue, he was brought closer to his mother’s mouth, from where her tongue slipped out and dragged itself slowly across his surface. His panic soared into absolute terror as the soaking muscle left it’s wet mark upon the entirety of his front side, and somehow that terror broke the absolute limit as he watched her mouth slowly open before him. The glistening, pink cave was more than willing to accept him, to thoroughly chomp and chew him for the pleasure of it’s master, and was more than likely planning on sending him down the dark and haunting abyss that rested at it’s end.

With ever once of his being, Blake fought against the fog in his mind as he desperately tried to stir up enough magic for a telepathy spell. He could feel the hot breath tingly along his minty skin as he was drawn closer and closer towards Claire’s awaiting cavern. Focus! Focus!

With his destination, her expecting tongue, only a second away, Blake finally screamed out. “MOM! STOP!”
0353321.title: Claire's Minty Son

choices: Claire finds out that she swallowed Blake and tries to help.
Blake goes unnoticed, much to his dismay.
03533212.content:
Blake's calling went unnoticed as Claire tossed his minty form into her mouth. Had he not been transformed into an edible form....and willing, he would be enjoying this.

As so as she tossed the boy in, Claire immediately began sucking on her son's minty body. Blake, despite not being happy with his current predicament, couldn't lie to himself and say that he wasn't enjoying the feeling of being in his mother's mouth.

Despite the hypnotic feeling of being inside the mouth of Claire, the mage panicked when he started to slide towards the woman's throat. He tried shouting again, but he was interrupted by being swallowed by the woman and began sliding down Claire's esophagus.

He then fell into the woman's large stomach, which thankfully hadn't detected the boy's presence yet. He finally decided to let out one more shout, desperately, "MOM! PLEASE HELP!"
03533212.title: Claire doesn’t hear him and continues.

035332122.content:
Unfortunately, Blake’s screams for help went unheard within his mother’s stomach, since he was currently a mint with no mouth. The juices eventually became active snd started to bubble, rapidly eating away at Blake’s minty body. In little time at all, he blacked out...

Claire noticed a strange aftertaste in that mint she’d just swallowed. It seemed awfully...familiar. Shrugging, the woman stood up to prepare for another work day.

Soon, Blake awoke to see something blocking his view of the outside world. Curiously, he was yet again unable to move! But then, how could he still be conscious after being digested by his mother?

It became apparent that Blake’s soul had become trapped in Claire’s...
035332122.title: Digested by Claire

0353322.content:
Watching her hated nemesis vanish before her very eyes had left Raven with a satisfied smirk on her face. It was such a rush watching him disappear with that deliciously terrified expression on his face, off to be whatever object fate decided he’d be. She’d remember that face for the rest of her long life, and would most certainly use it to cheer herself up when she happened to be down in the dumps.

Yet, after some recollection, she quickly came to find it disappointing. Sure, her enemy was gone for the moment, forced against his will to become an item for someone else’s (hopefully painful) use, but for how long would he stay gone? The spell, as powerful as it was, was also completely random in what it turned it’s target into and where they went. What was to say he didn’t end up discovered by someone more than willing and able to help return him to normal. That, she mused with a scowl, would be absolutely no fun.

She could still sense her spell clinging to him as it dragged his unwilling soul farther and farther away. A nefarious idea fluttered into her head. While she couldn’t change the course of the spell, she could trick it through a portal to another realm. And that would put her dear little nemesis in an even deeper level of trouble.

Her mind set, Raven closed her eyes and whispered the enchantment for the portal spell. She sensed it burst to life right ahead of the brat’s soul and swallow it up, before fading away just as quickly as it appeared. A maniacal grin spread ear-to-ear on Raven’s face. “Please don’t enjoy the trip, you brat!”

---

When Blake finally regained consciousness, he found he had been transformed into...
0353322.title: Raven's Extra Mile

choices: He was all alone at the opposite end of the underworld
Raven was waiting for him to lay a curse on Blake.
Lord Samedi was waiting for him with a challenge
He was standing right in a trap
04.content:
A new dawn has risen over Blake's hometown as he woke up for his big day. This was the day his magic would finally pay off! While sleepy looking through his spellbook last night, he finally found a recipe for a potion that would make Aria fall in love with him.

Blake was to excited to sleep and had made the batch of potion under the light of the moon. Letting out a big yawn, he slipped into his clothes and walked out of his house to get the love of his life. Blake had an easy plan, he was going to cover a piece of cake he had saved for her with the potion and let Aria eat it, then she would soon fall madly in love with him and they could be happy forever!

As Blake reached the front door of his crush, he began to feel nervous and scared. "Y-you can do this Blake." The mage told himself, knocking on the door to alert Aria. The door swung open to reveal the beautiful face of Blake's crush, Aria. With a smile she greeted him, "Oh hi Blake, what's up?" He calm voice floating through the air.

"O-oh hey Aria....I I'm, did some baking last night and I...Thought you might want a slice of my cake?" Blake said, embarrassment on his face and in his voice. Aria giggled in response and took the cake gently from him, "Of course Blake, I love baked goods." She happily said, ripping off a tiny piece and eating it.

The two had a breif conversation while Aria ate the rest of her treat. "Well Blake it was nice.....To,.....Ohhh....I don't feel well..." She said, leaning around before falling into the mages arms. "A-aria?! Are you alright?!?" Blake asked with fear, not knowing what went wrong.

He quickly casted a transportation spell to bring them both to Blake's secret hideout, placing Aria safely on a bed. "Aria, speak to me!" The mage yelled out, pleading that he hadn't killed his crush. As he looked down at her, he saw Aria slowly open her eyes....As well as something else....Aria's hand was see through!

"Oh no....What did I do?!" Blake yelled as he started to flip through his spellbook to the page he found. His heart stopped as he reread the page from last night. "This love potion was used by spirits to attract the ones they loved in the afterlife. This potion is not to be used on living creatures, as it will slowly turn them into a phantom before disappearing all together! This fatal transformation is know as Phantasmic Syndrome."

Blake felt like he had just killed the one person he loved. Aria looked up weakly at her friend, "B-blake...W-what did you do to me?" She said, lifitng her hand up into view. "B-blake?! W-whats going on?!" Aria began to panic. The mage quickly tried to calm her down, "A-aria please...I'm going to fix this....I need a cure."

Looking back in the book, Blake let out a gasp at the next bit of information. "The only cure for Phantasmic Syndrome can be found at the heart of the underworld, the land of the dead, the demon kings castle." This wasn't looking good for Blake. Very few have ever survived a trip to see Lord Samedi and lived to tell the tale. "Blake...Please...What happened." Aria asked so very afraid.

Blake let out a small tear before going to the bedside of his love, "Aria...I need to go and find a cure for you. Please stay here, you'll be safe and sound......I have been....Meaning to tell you this for awhile.....I'm actually....A mage...." He said shyly as it felt like he had let doelwn his crush. "I can answer any questions you have when I get back. But I need to go find your cute before you *gulps* ... . Disappear forever."

Before Aria could protest, Blake had already summoned a portal. Looking back, he blew Aria a kiss before stepping inside letting the portal close behind him. As he arrive in the underworld, Blake found that.....
04.title: Illness of Love

choices: Amazing! Blake mops the floor with Samedi.
Blake forfeits, and asks Samedi for other options.
043.content:
As Blake arrived in the dark depths of the underworld, he noticed a tall, spooky figure in the clearing. This mysterious figure was wearing a black cloak, black boots, and a top hat decorated with skulls. Surely this was the ruler of the underworld, the deity of death...

"Lord Samedi..!" Blake gasped.

The underworld king turned toward the mage. "Ah, Blake Heart...the only mage left in New Opal. I've heard about your love interest's condition...and I may be able to help you." For a death god that looked so threatening, Lord Samedi was surprisingly friendly.

"R-really?" Blake's eyes lit up. "You can cure Aria's illness?"

"If you complete a challenge, that is."

Blake gulped, but realized there might not be much time to argue. "Anything to save the girl I love!"

"Very well, then."

Lord Samedi summoned a massive board onto the ground nearby, and upon this board he conjured up a substantial number of...tokens?

"Your task..." Samedi began to explain, "...is to beat me in a game of Giant Backgammon."

Blake blinked. "...Backgammon?"

"Because, well, chess is just cliche by now. Anyway...if you win, I'll fix up Aria for free, no questions asked. But if you lose...her restoration will come at a heavy price!"

"...very well. I accept your challenge!" Blake nodded.

Oh, by the way...how good is Blake at backgammon?
043.title: Lord Samedi's "Challenge"

0432.content:
Blake had no experience playing backgammon...let alone GIANT backgammon. In mere minutes, Lord Samedi had already defeated the poor mage.

"Aria..." Blake said, tears forming in his eyes. "I'm so sorry..!"

"Now, now, Blake..." Lord Samedi put a bony hand on Blake's shoulder. "There IS another way to cure the love of your life...but it will come at your expense!"

Blake tried to pull together, and quickly realized that there was no other way to prevent Aria from disappearing forever. "...I just don't want Aria to pay for my foolish actions! Please, I'll do anything!"

"Fine, then. I'll cure Aria of her Phantasmic Syndrome right away, but it will cost you..."
0432.title: Crushing Defeat, and One Last Chance

0433.content:
Blake took a long look at the board, feeling completely overwhelmed and hopeless. "I have no idea how to play this Lord Samedi....Do you have any other options?" The mage asked, feeling a bit nervousness pumping through him.

Samedi let out a disappointed and upset sigh as he snapped his fingers. "Alright then Blake....Since you don't want to even try, I have just the reward for you." The dark lord said, an evil grin returning to his face. "You would have been better off if you faced me the first time. I hope you're ready, because I know she is...."

Blake was completely confused as the Lord Samedi called over a strange shadow from afar. Stepping into the light, Blake immediately recognized that dark and evil figure. "Raven!" Lord Samedi let out an evil chuckle while he stood beside her. "Well Blake, here's you alternative. Raven has been telling me how she has needed a test subject for quite sometime now....And she has told me how you would be perfect."

Ravens smile grew as she lifted her wand towards Blake, "Samedi told me you need to survive a week with me! Only then will you get your precious potion." With a flash of light, Blake felt himself changing....But it wasn't untill he opened his eyes and saw the massive boot of Raven that he knew what happened.

Another evil laugh came from above, looking up, Raven now towered over Blake. "Well Blake, now you're all mine for the week. The perfect subject for my spells. Oh, and don't worry, I've made your body durable." Raven said, lifting a foot over the tiny mage. Blake tried to run, but he was caught right under Ravens boot. He screamed, thinking this was it.....But Blake was still alive!

Raven had made Blake's body elastic, so instead of this being the end, his body flattend out under her boot like paper. The dark mage grinded and twisted her foot into the squished mage. "Your week starts now, and I think I'll place you......
0433.title: Slave of a Rival

choices: ....Look for a loophole to keep Blake underfoot longer
....Take the week, and make it count.
04332.content:
"....In my boot."

Blake swallowed, or at least would have, if he had any air to breathe beneath Raven's foot. The woman smirked up above him, lifting her foot off of the shrunken mage. Blake struggled to get up, or move at all, but found himself barely able to budge. His squished and twisted form was taking several moments to recover from his rival's aggressive stomp. He was completely powerless to resist as Raven reached down to pluck him from the ground. An inch away from snatching Blake up, however, Raven hesitated, and a callous smirk crossed her lips.

"No, you're not worth it."

Blake gave a sigh of relief, thinking that Raven had reconsidered, but the sorceress continued.

"Picking up with my fingers that is. That's just gross. All you are is foot dirt now, Blake." Blake's heart plummeted, as he watched Raven slide off her boot, revealing a pale, bare foot, glistening with sweat. Her foot hovered over Blake for several moments as Raven drank in her rival's humiliation. Then stomped down onto Blake, instantly undoing all of Blake's progress in reconstituting himself. Raven scraped her foot back and forth over Blake several moments, crushing and flattening him under her sole, like putty, before lifting up. For one long, agonizing moment, Blake felt himself painfully pulled between the ground and Raven's foot. Just like gum. Dammit, Raven had turned him into human gum! Unfortunately for Blake, Raven's foot won the tug of war, and he snapped up into her sole. stuck fast. Raven giggled like a school girl as she slowly took hold of her boot. True she could have done all this much faster, but she wanted to savor this moment.

Raven drew her boot closer, and then, making sure Blake had as good a view as possible, began to slide her foot inside. Blake's world began to dim, and grow hotter as Raven pulled her tight, suffocating boot on. Blake found he was struggling to breathe. The air was so thick and humid in here. One couldn't say that Raven's feet were the worst smelling things he'd ever encountered, to be fair. It seemed she cared for at least basic hygiene. But a day up on her feet, in these boots, was sure to cause anyone's feet to develop the atmosphere Blake found himself suffering in.

Suddenly, and without warning, he felt a tremendous pressure crush down on him. To be honest.... To merely call it "pressure" was to do it disservice. It was unlikely that any human had ever experienced this kind of weight pressed upon them, without expiring instantly. Before they had the chance to feel much pain at all. Blake, was not so fortunate. Blake tried to scream out in pain, but had no breath for it. He then realized that this unbelievable crushing pressure-- as though a mountain was placed on top of him, was nothing more than Raven standing. The heat, the pressure, the stink... If hell existed (and Blake was fairly certain it did), this must be something of what it was like.

Then Raven started walking. The process was dizzying, and, in some ways, even worse than the consistent pressure. Blake experienced vertigo, as her foot lifted and fell again, crushing him with new force each and every time. From his small size, it felt like Raven was moving impossibly fast, not slow and ponderous as a giant might be expected. And with every step, it was as though a meteor was falling on Blake. And yet, her spell held true and Blake wasn't killed.

Raven, meanwhile, had an extra skip in her step. This was amazing! Her foolish rival, practically gift wrapped for her. And she had an entire week to do with as she pleased with him. One hundred and sixty eight hours. Over ten thousand minutes. And she knew, with a wicked smile, that every one of those minutes would feel like days to Blake. But as she followed this line of thought, she began to wonder. Maybe this didn't have to be limited to only a week. She paused for a moment, pressing as much weight as possible onto Blake, and feeling the tiny mage squish pleasantly under her sole. Did she really have to release Blake after an entire week? Or could she maybe figure out a loophole in her rival's contract to keep him longer? After all, she had lots of experiments, and Blake did feel good underfoot. But then again, while Lord Samedi could respect a good argument, he was equally dangerous to cross or disappoint. As her rival underfoot right now could attest. As Raven considered this, she began to tap her foot on Blake, tormenting him further, but also so that she could feel that wonderful little "squish" as her foot came down each time. She smiled. This was like a gel insole, only even better!

Raven quickly came to a decision and began to stride off again. Raven's decision was....
04332.title: "In my boot"

choices: "...a taste test, and perhaps some binding magic"
"...a test of durability to see how strong he really is"
043321.content:
Raven wasn't going to let an opportunity like this disappear just because of Lord Samedi's deal. There had to be a way to keep Blake in his proper place, and she was determined to find the loophole to do so. Giving a firm stomp, Raven let out a delighted chuckle as the young mage smeared across her toes. "Lord Samedi takes time in writing his deals, but something tells me he didn't quite think this one through for you, Blake."

Raven happily stomped her way back to the place she called home. A small Manor sat on a hill, raised over the rest of the surrounding area. It might seen as just a typical "spooky" location, but Raven had chosen that spot specifically so she could always know she was above everyone else. That included the stain in her boot looking to fix his true love. This Aria girl was just an innocent caught in the way of Ravens goal; but it was the price to pay to put Blake where he belonged.

As Raven entered her home she made her way straight to the letter sent by Lord Samedi, just as Blake had entered the underworld. "If Blake should choose an alternative trial, he shall be entrusted to you for a week. You may do whatever you wish with him, but he must be freed and rewarded at the end." Raven looked over this passage again and again. It wasn't a long agreement, yet the wording made her think this would work in her favor.

Poor Blake was left to be idly toyed with as Raven tried to find any excuse to keep him longer. Each of the toes drummed away on the squished mage's body. A small symphony of squishes and weak groans echoing inside Ravens boot. Any chance of relief for Blake was instantly shot down by the firm clenching of the toes surrounding his face. "AHA! That's it! Oh Blake, you're in for the long haul now~" she said with a devilish smirk, quickly grabbing a potion meant to take her straight to Lord Samedi in the event of an emergency. To Raven, this was of the upmost importance~

Lord Samedi was sitting in his personal throne, as if expecting Ravens arrival all this time. When the black clad figure finally appeared before him, the silence was quickly broken. "What is it now, Raven. Come to argue against my deal...again?" Normally, in a situation like this, she would be terrified of upsetting Lord Samedi when things were going her way. But confidence was running through Raven, she knew she could win this debate.

"Yes, in fact, I have and with good reasoning too. You weren't clear when you set the length of time to a week!"

A moment of silence overtook the chamber, Lord Samedi's expression staying mute as the words sunk in. "....a week means a week, Raven." He plainly said, quickly being countered by Raven. "But for how long? You didn't say if it was by underworld time, earth time, other planets, or other plains of existence. If I were to go...say somewhere else where a week isn't seven days, then your deal isn't over untill a week passes there."

Lord Samedi's expression perked up a bit, he was impressed. It was rare that a being could win a debate against him, especially when a deal was on the line. Blake on the other hand was terrified. The thought of being stuck with Raven as a test subject for more than a week was unthinkable! He had to get that potion to help Aria, what was she thinking back home? Alone and becoming a spirit with each passing moment; and it was all Blake's fault.

"Raven...I can't believe I'm saying this, but by my own deal...you are correct. If Blake is in a realm where time moves at a different pace, then his week lasts as long as it does in that world." Raven nearly screamed with joy right then and there. Instead, her toes slapped down in excitement. Five massive roommates welcoming there newest friend to an extended stay. "Thank you, Lord Samedi, I just want to clarify that little detail before I ventured off with Blake. I've got some tests to try out in him at our new destination~ Which of course will be the Venuclear Plain, where a single day is 243 days on Earth. Blake will either learn to enjoy his position...or I might get bored and bring him back~ Now then, farewell Lord Samedi, I'm off to try out my next test on Blake. Which just so happens to be..."
043321.title: Loophole of Doom

045.content:
Blake found himself on a greyish plateau of the underworld. Souls flew about, wandering through the endless expanses of the realm, chatting with one another and sharing terrible jokes. Bones were littered all over the ground, some even forming surprisingly sturdy bridges. Below one of these skeletal structures were the dark blue waters of the River Rox, flowing ever so calmly. The mage felt a certain stuffiness in the underworld air, but it was still manageable.

Then, in the clearing appeared a dark-cloaked figure. He was a rather tall fellow compared to Blake, and he wore a top hat decorated with skulls. His hands were nothing but bone, and as he turned around, Blake recognized this figure...

"Lord Samedi!"

"Ah, if it isn't Blake Heart!" Samedi smiled. For a deity of death, he was surprisingly friendly with visitors. "I know of your little...predicament. But in order to cure Aria, the love of your life, you must complete a challenge."

The underworld ruler snapped his bony fingers, and in a puff of purple smoke appeared a familiar woman in a dark purple dress.

Blake's face went pale. "Raven..!"

"That's right, Blakey..." Raven taunted. "And now, you'll have to survive a day as my slave!!"

"Nope, that's not it..." Lord Samedi shook his head.

"Wait, it's not?!"

"No. You two will have to complete this trial...as a team."

"What?!" Blake and Raven retorted.

"You heard me. Alone, your powers wouldn't get either of you through the more dangerous regions of the underworld. But together, you might have a chance! ...Not much of a chance, but still a chance."

And with that, Lord Samedi vanished in a burst of black smoke before leaving some last guidance. "Your first ingredient waits at the volcanic heart of Volatile Valley, just east from here."

Blake couldn't believe what he'd gotten himself into...but if he wanted to save his crush from onlivion, he'd have to press on.

"You know, Blake..." Raven sighed. "I REALLY don't like you. But, since my own existence could be at risk, as well as my social life, I'll help you out on your little quest. Besides, there's the saying 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend'."

"Oh..." Blake spoke at last. "Well, Lord Samedi isn't really my enemy..."

"See, THAT'S why I don't like you."
045.title: An Unlikely Team

choices: "...how do we get past all these traps?"
"...there's a big three-headed dog guarding it!"
0451.content:
With their begrudging alliance formed at last, Blake and Raven made their way from the underworld plateau to the fiery wastes of Volatile Valley, the first stop on their quest to cure Aria of her Phantasmic Syndrome. In the distance was the active volcano mentioned by Lord Samedi...

"Mt. Mortem..." Blake marveled at the sight of the volcano.

"The resting place of the fabled Crisp Crust..." Raven added.

"Crisp Crust?"

"The first ingredient for your potion. That mythical donut was baked using the sheer heat of Mt. Mortem -- "

"A donut..? A STINKING DONUT?!"

"Look, we don't have time to question underworld cuisine! Let's get moving."

The pair of mages stepped carefully across several stones on a river of lava, eventually making their way through a deep tunnel into the heart of the volcano.

"We...we actually did it..." Raven smiled, grateful for cooperating with Blake...for once.

"We survived the trip into Mt. Mortem!" Blake cheered. "Now we can get the Crisp Crust...wait..."
0451.title: Fired Up

04513.content:
“Grrrrrrrr..!”

Blake and Raven heard an unhappy growl from up ahead - THREE unhappy growls, actually. Peering over, Raven noticed the Crisp Crust resting on an obsidian pedestal. Guarding said pedestal was a giant, three-headed dog! Blake was shaking with unmatched fear - a dog had ripped his pants off sometime last year.

“Slobberus!” Raven exclaimed. She seemed familiar with this colossal canine...

While extremely afraid of Slobberus’ wrath, Blake knew that he couldn’t let Aria fade out of existence. Thinking quickly, the mage boy reached into his pocket and had the fortune of pulling out what looked to be a dark red ball! The hound’s growls ceased instantly at the sight of the ball - replaced with eager smiles.

Blake knew what to do from here. “Alright, doggy...fetch!!”

Slobberus watched as Blake threw the crimson ball into the entry tunnel of Mt. Mortem, hastily chasing the sphere as it bounced away from the volcano. With that out of the way, Blake approached the pedestal and claimed the Crisp Crust. One ingredient down!

“I hate to admit it,” Raven spoke, “but that was impressive! This whole teaming-up thing might not be such a bad thing after all...”

“Congrats, you too!” The pair heard Lord Samedi’s voice. “You’ve obtained the Crisp Crust, the base for your antidote. Next, you’ll need to acquire some Freezy Frosting - located in Frostbite Fjord, to the north.”

“They really need more creative names for their ingredients...” Blake mused to himself as he and Raven continued their dangerous quest.
