Amy was quick to waste no time to scoop up Blake, excitedly taking his slight confidence as full reason to speed ahead with the idea. "Then its a yes!" She beams down at the half-inch boy in her hands. "I'll call, but ask Claire to come tomorrow--Before that, we need to head to the lab! I'm probably about to pull an all-nighter."

Blake grimaces and sits with his arms held out in Amy's palm in a vain attempt to steady himself against Amy's excited jitters. "Uh, why take so long? Can't you just call my mom and have her come over now?"

Amy shook her head. "We're doing this without telling Claire, right? I need to get a tracker on you, or else Claire might lose you without you knowing..." Her other hand lifted to lightly tap against her cheek the smile growing more mischievous,. "And maybe, just maybe, add some other features too." Amy suddenly forces a serious expression, barely hiding her emotions to Blake. "Entirely intended to keep you safe. Of course."

Blake blinks up at Amy, largely unamused and mildly concerned with her intent. Still he gives in, getting the feeling he hasn't much choice at this point. "Well, I suppose you're right. You've probably got got knows what kind of data you want to get from this whole experience too so; do your worst?"

"Since you asked..." Amy trailed off, letting out a dark chuckle and succeeding in making Blake yet more uncomfortable.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

At the end of said "all-nighter", Blake awoke with a stir on a table in Amy's lab, with Amy looking directly over him with a gleeful smile. "Well, the tracker is in! Do you feel alright? No pain?"

Blake groggily tried to sit up and examine himself. Amy had managed to put him to sleep for... Whatever she did, but upon a thorough examination he couldn't find any signs of cuts, scars, or any other means by which she could have put a tracker in him. Weird. "I feel alright, surprisingly." Blake reported to Amy. "Not sure how but I'm not hurt."

With a squint, Amy bent down to get a better look with her own eyes at Blake. "Well, judging by how you don't seem to be wincing, I'll take that as confirmation that you aren't lying." She grinned down to him. "Now, we've only got an hour before Claire comes over. You ready to get into position?"

Looking up at her looming face, yet again put at unease, Blake questioned. "You're really taking this seriously? Did you cook up some crazy plan to make this work?"

Amy looked away momentarily, dusting off her lab coat. "I did indeed--but the plan will work out better if I don't tell you what it is." She chuckled again.

Blake shook his head, now uncertain but still committed. "Let's do this, I guess..."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

An hour later, Blake had been placed on a table in the foyer of Amy's house. Amy was quick to instruct him to hide behind a large candle in a glass jar and wait until she had come back to place him in Claire's shoe.

Claire soon knocked on the door, and Amy came to answer it promptly. "Hello, Claire! How's your day going so far?" Amy had managed a normal enough smile to hide her intent from Claire.

Claire stepped in, and Blake momentarily saw that she was wearing a dark-green blouse, denim capri pants, and the same heels he had hidden in to get to the party. "I'm good, but I'm still worried about Blake! Speaking of which, where is he?" She questioned, looking around. Blake managed to retreat back behind the candle.

Amy gave a sigh. "Well, I'm afraid he stayed up longer than he wanted to last night, so he's grabbing some more shut eye, but I suspect he might not wake up until the evening at best." Before Claire could respond, Amy motioned toward the blonde's feet and changed the subject. "I'd hate to ask you this, but could you please leave your shoes at the door? I just had new flooring put in and I'm trying to keep in clean before we put a coat of wax on it."

Claire stammers, somewhat taken by surprise with the sudden change in tone. "Well, of course, but I think I'll have to talk with Blake about staying awake so late." She gently slides her feet out of her heels before the two women walked into the living room to have a conversation.

Blake slowly walked out from behind the candle, looking over the table and down at Claire's black heels, seeing the silver insole on the inside. A part of him was a little excited to do this--even though it was his mother's shoes and feet. Was Amy having this effect on him?

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

"...Okay, okay, I know I promised Blake that I'd keep this a secret, but you are his mother, I have to tell you." Amy interjected in the middle of their conversation about her escapades with Blake. "I know he said that he shrunk himself to try and hitch a ride to the party; but we both know how little sense that makes. Do you know what it really is?"

The two ladies were sitting on opposite sides of the couch in Amy's living room, and just where Blake couldn't make out the conversation.

Claire, already concerned with what Amy had been doing with her son only raised an eyebrow out of concern. "I have no idea, what would the actual reason be?"

Amy smiled, but nearly cracked a smirk, the only sign that she was about to lie-- "He wanted to be in your shoe."

Claire shook her head, sitting up and curling her legs inward onto the couch. "I'm sorry, but, he wanted to be in my shoe?"

Amy nodded with a chuckle. "I know, right? This whole time he's been enjoying being under my foot, but he's always been saying 'I kinda want to do this with mom too' with almost everything. He even said he wanted to shrink even smaller so he could be in those heels you wear to work all the time without you knowing!"

Claire looked to the side, somewhat confused but starting to process what Amy had been saying, even if it was incorrect. "Now that you mention it, I did once notice Blake looking at my shoes..." She trailed off in thought, con. "But I assumed that was just a matter of coincidence. You're saying that he had possibly been planning this because he has a thing for feet?"

The blonde lightly sighed. "Perhaps I'll make that part of his punishment. I'll leave him in my shoe for a day to try and figure out if that was what he was really after." Claire took a moment to stretch, letting her feet contact with the floor again. "Well, this has been an enlightening conversation, Amy, but I'm afraid I have errands I have to run before noon. If you don't mind, where is your bathroom? I need to go before I leave."

Amy smiled again, knowing her chance had come. She pointed behind her. "Second door on the left down that hallway."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

Blake could hear the bathroom door closing, followed by the footsteps of Amy headed over to where he had been hiding. Seeing her approach, Blake emerged from his hiding spot prompting Amy to quickly and unceremoniously grab him gently between two fingers and drop him into Claire's left heel.

"This seems to be going well!" Blake looked around in his instep of his mother's work shoe. "What did you and my mom talk about anyway?"

Amy smirked. "Oh, nothing too important..." Amy's hand went inside one of her lab coat's pockets, pressing some sort of button before another flash of light engulfed Blake, sending him into a minor panic before the light dissipated. He had to be another 1/10 of his former size now, maybe even less. At his best guess, he was either a millimeter or 1/25th of an inch tall, not that the difference between the two would matter.

Blake freaked out wondering if this had been Amy's doing, before her voice boomed down to answer the question he was probably too small to ask now. "I'm sorry, Blake, but I think you'll understand in time." She moved to stand up. "As much as I am enjoying this, the truth is if I'm to commercialize anything from this, I first need to know how long someone can last underfoot in good health." The smirk grew into a more devious grin. "Now, don't worry, that tracker will monitor your vitals and I'll come get you from Claire the moment something goes completely South but, for now, you won't mind spending a month or two living off the sweat and dirt in Claire's shoe, will you?"

Blake was utterly devastated at Amy going to these lengths. Sure she had some crazy things planned but going to this level? He was too dumbfounded to try and respond as Amy stood back up and waited by the door for Claire.

Just in time too, as the bathroom door had opened and Claire's footsteps were quickly approaching the foyer...
0542212211111111111132.title: Amy Insists and Adds a Minor Detail Without Tel...

0552.content:
It was a breezy summer evening in New Opal. The teenage mage Blake Heart was hanging out at the local bowling alley with his male friends, Rainer Storm (an African-American who wore blue and was a fan of pirates) and Kendal Flicker (a Japanese fellow in red who favored ninjas). Despite not being much of an athlete, Blake gave the game his all...not that it was enough to surpass his friends’ scores. He didn’t want to use magic to cheat — Rainer and Kendal knew he had powers, but any other witnesses could land Blake in serious trouble!

After their match, the three high-school boys started to walk their way uptown, the sun beginning to set in the west.

“Ya know, bowling’s fun and all...” Rainer spoke up, “...but we should really liven things up!”

“Liven things up?” Kendal asked. “Like...how?”

“I got it! Why don’t we embark on a panty raid?”

Blake’s eyes widened. “Uh...are you sure that’s a good idea?”

“Not really,” Rainer replied, “but you’ve got magic, Blake! Why don’t you conjure up a little spell to make us tiny? We’ll be stealthier that way!”

“He has a point...” Kendal said.

“C’mon, Blake!” Rainer leaned on his mage buddy’s shoulder. “It’ll be fun!”

Blake let out a sigh. “Alright...I’ll shrink us down to half an inch tall. That small enough?”

“That’ll do!” Kendal nodded.

Blake closed his eyes and focused his willpower into a spell. A purple glow surrounded the boys, and in a bright flash, they were no longer outside.

The otherworldly luminescence brought the trio into what appeared to be a living room. No other people were in the room, but the furniture looked much taller than it should have been.

The shrinking spell...it actually worked!

“By the looks of it...” Rainer deduced out loud, “...it seems we’re now in...”

05531.content:
It was a nice, sunny day in the peaceful town of New Opal. In a rather large and fancy residence, the goth-like girl, Violet Andross, had discovered a new book of spells in her family's library. She decided to invite her friend, Blake Heart, as well as his sister Jade, over to her house to show them the mysterious tome (Blake and Jade didn't tell their mother about the magic part, of course). After a decent walk, the two siblings arrived at the front door of Violet's house, greeted by the normally-shy goth girl.

"Hi, Violet!" Jade smiled.

"Hey, Violet," Blake followed up, "so where's that spellbook you were talking about?"

"It's in the library, still..." Violet stated, leading her friends into the fairly large and sophisticated room of bookshelves, telescopes, and...more bookshelves. On a small wooden table rested the strange new book.

"So what kind of spells are in here?" Blake asked, eager to know what he was in for.

"Well..." Violet blushed, "...I have no idea."

A low growl suddenly interrupted the conversation. Letting out an embarrassed sigh, Jade put a hand to her stomach.

"Sorry..." Jade apologized. "Got any snacks around here?"

"Sure thing!" Violet grinned. "They're in the kitchen, I'll be right back."

The goth girl trotted toward the kitchen, leaving the Heart siblings alone with the eerie spellbook. Not a smart choice, admittedly. Jade, brimming with curiosity, opened the book and flipped through pages, not seeming to care for the paper's condition.

"Jade, be careful with that!" Blake ordered, grabbing onto the book.

"Hey, I'm just having fun over here!" Jade responded, not about to let her party-pooper of a brother ruin her enjoyment. As the two tugged at the tome, it suddenly began to glow an ominous purple, before emitting a bright flash that knocked them out cold...

Miraculously, they regained their senses rather quickly. Blake looked around the room, noticing something wasn't quite right. Jade's eyes widened as she and her brother saw the bookshelves tower over them.

That book had shrunken the siblings to half an inch in size!!

"Darn it, Jade!!" Blake scolded his sister. "You need to be careful! Magic is unpredictable, you know!"

"Sorry, bro..." Jade frowned. "But we need to find Violet and get her help!"

And with that...

When they arrive, Blake and Jade spotted Violet at the counter, fixing a couple of sandwiches for her guests, still unaware that they are in the kitchen, shrunken. As Violet was about to finish the snack preparations, her cell phone begins to ring in a calm musical tone, though it's deafening to the Heart siblings.

"Hello...? Oh hey...yeah, Blake and his sister Jade are over here....Yeah, you can come over if you like..." Violet talks to the caller. While being preoccupied, Blake and Jade are getting closer to her feet.

"Well, at least she's not moving, but what do we do now? Climbing her would take us forever!" Jade asked her older brother while heading towards Violet's foot.

"We do this, of course!" Blake said before grabbing his sister's hand. "Wind! Air! Lift me!"

"What are you dooooiiiiing!?" Jade screams as she and Blake take off into the air, flying past Violet's colossal foot. "S-Since when did you learn how to f-fly!?"

"It's in the practice book! We should reach up to her face in no time!" Blake grins, very confident of his magic while Jade frighteningly clings on his arm, hoping not to fall at the increasing height as they go up higher and higher.

They flew past her towering skirt, passing through the frills of it, reaching to her bare stomach level, hearing her stomach rumbles in hunger, and finally reach to her chest which made Blake blushes like crazy from the sight of her now mountain size breasts...did they make it to her face?
055311.title: To the Kitchen!

0553111.content:
"What the..?"

Blake began to worry as the ascent suddenly stopped, Jade still holding onto her brother's arm. The wind magic had worn off just as the siblings had reached Violet's chin! The tiny teens held on to each other as they fell, praying for a soft landing...

...and boy, did they get one!

Jade found herself wedged between two massive, fleshy orbs up to her waist. Her brother was up to his neck between them, and blushing madly. Judging from all that, the siblings realized they were in Violet's cleavage! What a place to land.

Violet, meanwhile, continued to chat with her caller, still oblivious to the shrunken siblings between her breasts. Was she talking to someone Blake knew from school? Or...somebody else?

Blake was in no state to ponder such questions. He was an inch tall, in a girl's cleavage! His hormones were driving him mad, and he tried to resist any pervy urges that came to mind...

Violet peered down at the shrunken siblings as she picked up her half-eaten sandwhich. "Like I said, you guys should be safe in there." She said through a mouthful. "I thought it'd be better than my cleavage. Not to brag or anything but you two could literally get squished in there."

Violet stifled a giggle as she put her plate in the sink. Their tiny bodies tickled against her skin. "Try not to squirm around too much." She said, sheepish cupping a hand over them. This is probably even more awkward for them than it is for me.

Not hearing the tiny siblings' voices, Violet decided to eat one of the many sandwiches on the tray. Grabbing a ham sandwich on white bread, the giantess bit down and thoroughly chewed the piece before gently swallowing.

0553122.title: Spotted by Violet..?

choices: Blake tries to get Ms. Solar to a quieter area
The news of Ms. Solar’s growth spreads quickly
05532.content:
(150 feet seems like a bit too much, even by giantess standards. I think 50 feet will make more sense...)

It was just another Friday at Opal High School, and Blake was feeling unusually...happy today. Sure, the school day was almost over, but the teenage boy was more excited to test out a new spell he’d learned early in the morning. Soon enough, the familiar ringing of the bell came, and students rushed out to enjoy the weekend. However, as Blake was about to exit the classroom...

“Blake, do you have a minute?”

That voice — it belonged to his teacher, Ms. Solar. Worrying he might be in trouble, Blake nervously approached the teacher’s desk.

“Y-yes, Ms. Solar?” Blake gulped.

“Don’t be nervous, you’re not in any trouble. I was actually wondering if you’d like to come to a student council meeting on Monday. We’re giving some thought to implementing some more clubs here at Opal High — cooking, electronic music, trading card games...”

As Ms. Solar continued to talk, a purple glow in Blake’s pocket started to worry him. His fears were realized when his teacher’s body faintly glowed the same color.

“Ms. Solar, are you OK?”

The teacher rubbed her head, trying to suppress a migraine. “Urgh...what’s happening?”

Blake sweated in a panic as he saw Ms. Solar start to grow taller...and taller...and taller still! Her increasing size caused the room’s ceiling to break, the debris falling near her feet. Feina Solar had become 50 feet tall from that purple aura...and she was utterly confused and frightened! All because of the spellbook in Blake’s pocket! The mage’s secrecy was now at risk...

What could he do to fix all this?
05532.title: Attack of the 50 Foot Teacher

choices: Mini Mage & Glimmer Gal to the rescue!
05533.content:
Option 13 (Mini Mage & Glimmer Gal): After Blake finally admits his feelings for Aria, the two officially become a couple, and Blake's size is restored to normal. However, he soon discovers that a portion of the spirits' gift remains in him -- in addition to his elemental spells, Blake can now (somewhat) control his size, able to shrink himself to half an inch tall...though he must wait at least half an hour before growing back to normal again. A mysterious organization somehow learns of Blake's newfound abilities and plots to steal his powers by any means necessary, initially sending two agents for this task. While trying to fend the agents off with elemental magic, Blake accidentally hits Aria with a thunderbolt, inadvertently bestowing her with elemental powers of her own! (She can't shrink, though.) Once the goons are dealt with, Blake and Aria decide to conceal their true identities and become the crime-fighting superheroes known only as Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal!

(NOTE: This option was inspired by Ace Corona's GiantessWorld story "MicroMage and Awesome-Girl". It's pretty interesting, so check it out if you can!)
05533.title: Superheroes, anyone?

055331.content:
"So, this is the place, right?" Aria pulled forward eagerly, walking through the old part of town.

Blake yelped gently, feet scattering as he tried to keep up with her pace. "Please, a little quieter..."

She covered her mouth, blushing gently. "Right. This is covert. I still have to get used to keeping secrets... It's frightening" Even when murmuring, her voice has a melodious presence and energy. Like a camera lens in ancient ruins, the young woman's eyes flashed around to take in the sights, blinking quickly. Until meeting Blake, she'd never have thought to walk around here. Everything was so overwhelming, but still cozy and quaint... They neared a bookshop. "But we are right around the spot? Just feet away from a portal to the underground world of magic... Metaphorically."

"Y-yeah, I think. I saw books hidden on this store's shelves by M. Alabaster and R. Carmine - they were part of the same mage circle as the one who wrote my own spellbook. And up there - " He pointed covertly to a spot hidden by shadows in the wall, an etching of an eye with complex lines coming from that could easily be mistaken for cracks " - is a protection symbol."

Aria squinted up, tracing out the pathways on the aging stone midair. "That's so observant." She turned her gaze to the door, standing quietly. Her shoulder leaned gently on his. He realized the young woman beside him was trusting him to lead the way.

Several times over the past week, the teenage mage had to take a deep breath, leave his inhibitions aside, and go forward. He did this again, entering the shop - unaware that the stone eye wasn't the only one watching.

-

One whole week. Almost impossible to believe. Even after a week, the warm touch of Aria's lips over his then half-inch body still stuck with him.

It had been a journey, for sure, ever since he made that bargain with the mischievous specters who gave him amazing strength in exchange for his size. A quest full of self-discovery and introspection, where he found feelings inside himself that he never knew about. And he grew closer to some friends, too, learning about the secret things they kept inside of them. (For example: digestive acids.) The greatest of his challenges - more taxing than any physical labor to lift away stomps, more horrifying than scaling mountain-sized body parts - was finally admitting his feelings for Aria. Aria, the sweet girl who was already magnificent and unreachable at normal size... Even in her hands, she looked more distant than ever.

But he survived. Finally, he revealed himself. And under her loving, accepting gaze, it took no time at all for the spell to wear off.

A week since all that...

-

Muscles quivering, he pushed back the door's wooden handle, as if it would explode in his hand. Size changing and strength changing, even in small doses, tended to throw one's sense of perspective and awareness of strength off completely. He practically stumbled into the dusty room, pulling Aria with him. There was a different shopkeeper than yesterday. A grey-haired woman looked from the counter, scanning the new entries before returning to her book. "Nice to see youngsters here. Not many who really know the power of reading."

Aria held him tighter. With her other hand, she brushed over a box of old comics, glancing over the dot-colored covers.

Her newly-minted boyfriend awkwardly slipped out "Yeah", half-coughing on the word.

"Let me know if you need help with anything." Her voice was still crisp and fresh, betraying the wrinkles that crossed her face.

"We're just browsing." Blake said.

"Anything by an M. Alabaster?" Aria said at the exact same time, drowning him out.

She gave a long stare, and checked through a paper catalog, glancing up in suspicion from time to time.

Blake awkwardly looked back to the shelves, ready to dart away, or even shrink away. Whelp, there it goes. Another person learning my secret life. No - our secret lives, now. Glancing over the same box Aria did, he noticed a cover for "Batman 241". How did you ever keep that hidden identity thing going, Bruce?

The old woman's voice rang out: "He can do it because he's rich."

The young mage twisted his head in surprise. She was still looking down, checking the list of books through fogged glasses.

"Why are you two here, really?" She said this all without moving her mouth. Telepathy - so she was a mage, too. An experienced one, at that. The elder went on: "A curious young spellcaster, I can understand. Bringing a normal girl with you? Very dangerous."

He thought of the answer. "She's not a normal girl. She's the nicest person ever..."

-

It was nice to have some closure after the adventure. But nicer, still, was knowing that it was the start of something else - not just a return to normality.

First off, the two teenagers had forged a bond. They were officially a couple. Both had so much more to learn from each other, about each other, challenges to face together... It was exciting. He could walk the halls with a smile, for the first time in ages.

With his body used to changing sizes, some good will from the spirits, and Aria's support, Blake managed to perform a spell he could never get the hang of before: shrinking. In an instant, he could regain his half-inch stature. It was a taxing action, for sure; he'd have to wait 30 minutes each time before conjuring the energy to reverse it. But he got the hang quickly.

The graceful young woman, herself, showed a slight interest in the spell-weaving arts. Gazing over his books, picking up a few phrases here and there. She knew that it would take lots of practice to reach her boyfriend's level. But it was nice, at least, to finally see what he was doing. The whole thing intrigued her.

They both knew that there would be excitement in the future. But they couldn't have predicted its form...

-

Mid-thought, the door swung open. Two figures entered quietly. First was a short, formally-dressed woman with reddish hair and gloves. She paced directly to the middle of the room. A man with a similar uniform and flowing blonde hair followed behind, his broad shoulders hitting the doorframe. He waved. Blake awkwardly nodded back; Aria smiled; the old woman looked up, and started slowly walking away from the desk, still holding the paper.

"Get out," she said telepathically.

Blake thought: "I'm sorry, I shouldn't have -"

The old woman's voice cut him off: "You can still save yourself from them."

He quickly grabbed Aria. She seemed to understand, too - a look of anxiety crossed her face. The smiling man stood in the way, taking up the whole frame. In his arms was an old piece of stone, bearing an eye... The same one that was on the outside wall before, now split in half. "Vermillion couldn't have found this without you! Merci beaucoup!"

The teenagers both gulped, looking at each other. Then, Aria's nose twitched. She turned back, and gulped, moving the boy's head to match hers. That small woman - Vermillion - had a cigarette lighter in one hand, and an oil can in the other. Before the store owner could react, she lit the bookshelves, her face beaming in the flames. "Keep blocking the door, Chartreuse. As of two seconds ago, these three are suspected arsonists. We'll do the community a service and take them in for questioning."

From the side, the old woman briefly chanted - and a thunderbolt emerged from her palm, directed right at Vermillion. Blake did the same. She held up a hand, letting it collapse against the rubber glove - then grabbing the elder sorceress by the wrist. They'd researched the old woman's powers before, Blake realized. One bolt bounced off her coated palm, hitting Aria directly in the forehead.

"No!" Blake called out.

She fell right into Chartreuse's arms, eyes looking blank. He fumbled for a moment, before grabbing her by the arms. "This feels good! Keeping dangerous magic out of the wrong hands, holding back kids who could destroy history with unholy influences... I'm glad I joined the Group for Total Security!"

She held the woman by the arms, and took out what looked like a tazer. "You sound like a salesman. Join GTS, save the world, retake humanity's destiny from ghouls and demons..."

"QUAKE!"

In a panic, Blake cast the spell. The ground shook, setting both of the agents off their footing. The man got up quickly, and charged for him.

As if on automatic, the boy chanted - and shrunk to a minuscule scale. Set off-guard by the sudden change, Chartreuse tripped towards the burning flames. He screamed from the searing pain, rushing out the door.

Vermillion swore, and tossed the panting older woman aside. She scanned the ground, immediately locating the fleeing Blake. Her leg lifted to the sky, glowing with the embers of ancient knowledge destroyed. Her heel was just too big. The inch-high boy couldn't dodge as she stomped down...

And a gust of wind hit her, sending her body into the fire. The mage-hunter screamed, following her partner out. "You'll regret this! GTS will overcome!"

Blake stood shocked, looking up. In an instant, huge jets of foamy water spurted out from above, cooling the fires out. He looked, and they came from the hand of - who else, but his wonderful girlfriend, Aria? Underneath a golden shoe, she smothered out the last few bits of fire.
055331.title: Mini Mage & Glimmer Gal - Origins

choices: Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal test out their powers
0553311.content:
After making sure the older woman was safe, Aria scooped up Blake in her hand. She quickly stroked his body, checking for any damage. "Are you alright? Did they hurt you?"

He trembled, still frozen from surprise. Her hand felt cool and soothing. "No, I'm fine. But... what was that?"

She looked at her palms, shrugging.

"The girl has elemental powers now." The older woman spoke telepathically - and this time, Aria could hear, too. "From our magic crossing. I didn't mean for any of this... Now, she's a target for GTS, too."

Blake looked up, confused. "GTS?" He felt a bit of Aria's soft skin cross his cheek.

The elder looked down solemnly. "The Group for Total Security. Founded by old witch-hunter clans coming together, they want to make the world safe for normal humans - by 'subduing' everyone using magic." Her head shook. "Those books are gone, no helping that. But they're after people, too. Some members are just scared, or confused. But some are looking for anything to kill and subdue... Or even to take the secrets for themselves."

Aria stepped forward quickly, shaking Blake. "But we can stop, them, right? I mean - I have the powers, now! I don't have the experience you do, but with my boyfriend's help..." She looked to him, a little worried. "You'll... help, right?"

He hesitated. So many times before, he'd barely fled danger, was left with lives flashing before his eyes. Just moments ago, he was sure he'd be smothered to death. Would he put himself back into that, and leave the safety of his normal life that past week?

If that terror was the same experience that the old woman had - that other mages would have - it wasn't a question. He'd made the decision long ago, when he picked up his spellbook. Blake smiled. "Of course! I'll do anything I can!"

The old women nodded solemnly. She slid her hand across a tile, revealing a set of old masks. One of them gold, glimmering in the light. The other sleek vantablack, hidden in the shadows. When she spoke again, she was speaking normally, not telepathically. "I can't stop you if you want to. But please, you'll need to hide your identities."

Aria nearly jumped, then remembered her passenger. "Like superheroes! My secret name will be... Hm. Wonder Thunder? Mahou Kamen? Golden Symphony?" She glanced over the charred books, identifying one about crafts - with glitter on the cover. "Ah! Glimmer Gal!"

Blake thought for a second. "If we're going for alliteration, I guess I'll be Mini Mage. It rolls of the tongue."

The elder clasped her hands together. "Good. Now use those powers wisely. And if you find any young mages led astray, or under threat - look for another store like this one. I know where they can find shelter."

Both of the teenagers nodded, and simultaneously thanked her.

She smiled. "Now get out, whippersnappers. They'll find you."

Aria went to the door, then stopped. She picked up a book on costume-making. "First, may I purchase this? We have books on the ancient art of magic already, but that won't help with the ancient art of fashion design..."

***

"Vermillion, it huuuurts. It hurts really bad."

"Burn scars - OW - will heal. It's no obstacle for - URGH - GTS! We shall overcome!"

The two agents sat in an alley, patching each other up.

"Geez, you think Boss Sylvia will give us new uniforms? These ones are all scorched. Urrrgh..."

"Remember, these uniforms don't make us who we are. We're just concerned citizens. OH! JEEZ-" She smiled fiercely, applying a bandage to him. "We'll do the next job undercover. Street clothes. Nobody will recognize us."

He grinned back. "Yeah! -Ow! Merde... Nobody will recognize you with your hair, either!"

The woman put a hand to her neck - only to find emptiness. The fire had seared a healthy chunk of her long, red hair out. Her smile only grew wider. Her hands fell loose, dropping the medical tools. She started chuckling, despite herself. "Crushed."

"Uh... Vermillion?" The blonde man scooted back - his hair now longer than his partner's. His bulky back hit a wall, sending a piercing pain through it.

"Crushed. Yes. They'll pay for this. The entire mage world, like insects gnawing away at rotting wood... Down to the last birthday party magician... Will be extinguished, only a footnote in history... But those two, in particular, will be given special treatment..." She kept laughing, now reeling over in a mix of burning pain and inexplicable mirth. "THEY'LL PAY FOR MY HAIR!"

He smiled, patting her head - and letting another spike of agony pierce her. "That's the spirit!... I... think..."

The busy street onlookers gave a quick, confused glances to the two.
0553311.title: Donning the masks

choices: What awaits Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal next?
05533111.content:
"HELP!! SOMEBODY, HELP!!"

The two teens had heard it. A cry of distress! They had to take action as soon as possible. Equiping their newly-received masks, Blake and Aria -- no, Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal -- rushed onto the scene. As it turned out, New Opal Bank was being subjected to a holdup -- the second one this week.

"Hands where I can see 'em!" The redheaded criminal in black yelled, armed with a machine gun and pointing it towards cowering civilians and tellers. He slowly approached one of the tellers, pointing his weapon at her.

"Gimme all your cash, lady!" The robber demanded. "ALL OF IT!!"

Utterly afraid that saying a word would get her killed, the teller quietly and carefully made her way to the bank's vault, inputting the security code and opening the safe, before fearfully moving out of the robber's way as he stomped into the vault full of moolah.

Outside the bank, Mini Mage concentrated his mind, and chanted a spell: "Shrink!" In an instant, the boy was once again half an inch in size and standing atop Glimmer Gal's palm. It was a good thing his clothes shrunk with him! ...strange, but still handy. "Glimmer Gal, I need you to throw me into the air vent!"

"Are you sure you'll be alright?" Glimmer Gal asked, concerned for the safety of the tiny hero in her hand.

"Probably not, but this is a risk we have to take!"

Nodding, Glimmer Gal flung her fellow crime-fighter into the vent opening, where he wormed his way through the steely tunnel. It took a minute for him to find a way to the bank vault, but he soon made it -- falling on his back in a pile of money. Seeing this, the robber laughed.

"Aww, you tryin' you stop me, little guy?" The criminal taunted. "Well, too bad! 'Cause all this money is -- "

An electric shock struck the thief in the back, knocking him out cold. Glimmer Gal, her hand smoking for a second, ran over to her partner and scooped him up, checking his body for injuries.

"You...you too..." the teller from before stammered. "You stopped this criminal?"

"I...I think so..." Mini Mage replied.

The crowd cheered. "Hooray, the bank is saved!" "You're heroes!" "Thanks a million!"

"Oh, don't mention it," Glimmer Gal smiled, "we're just doing our job."

In a flash, the two teenage superheroes had left the scene.
05533111.title: Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal: Bank On It

choices: The rest of the day is calm for the pair.
GTS forms its next plan of action...
055331111.content:
With Mini Mage perched in her palm, Glimmer Gal rushed out of New Opal Bank to seek out the couple's next great adventure. But before the masked teens could get very far, they skidded to a halt at the sight of a massive crowd -- police officers arriving to arrest the redheaded would-be thief, a crowd of civilians coming to cheer on the two superheroes, along with a cameraman and a bespectacled reporter girl checking out the latest scoop.

The reporter eagerly approached the crime-fighting duo. "Ah, Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal! I take it you're the ones who stopped the latest bank robbery some time ago?"

"It's only been five minutes..." Mini Mage stated.

"Ah, so you ARE the ones! I'm Lotta Mira, with Opal High School's publication on the paranormal, Daily Dirty Laundry."

"Hey, Lotta?" The cameraman spoke. "I gotta use the bathroom..."

"Ward!! Don't say that on camera!!" Lotta snapped at her goofball of a partner, before turning back to the superheroes. "Anyway, care to explain for our many viewers how exactly you managed to save the day?" ...WHAT viewers?

Mini Mage became quite flustered -- he always was a little camera shy. "Um...w-well..."

"Superheroes never share their secrets!" Glimmer Gal chimed in. "As much as we'd like to stay and be interviewed, we need to get back to keeping New Opal free of crime!"

Although they hated to be rude, Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal swiftly dashed from the scene, determined to protect the town from any evildoers who might attempt to...well, do evil.
055331111.title: Every superhero story needs a reporter!

choices: Continue with Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal
0553311112.content:
Unbeknownst to the two teenage superheroes, something particularly shady was occurring in one of the nearby buildings -- precisely, an abandoned gasoline and match factory. Vermillion and Chartreuse, still recovering from their encounter with Mini Mage and Glimmer Gal, made their way through the gap where the front door would be; an explosion must've blasted it off some years ago. The two GTS members came to wait in the center of the ruined room.

"I don't understand..." Chartreuse complained. "Why must the young practice such dangerous arts?"

"What matters?!" Vermillion replied. "Those two will pay for their meddling...for my hair...THEY'LL PAY FOR IT ALL!!" ...she STILL wasn't over that?

"Indeed, they will..."

The two GTS goons turned to see a rather tall, slender woman with long, straight, black hair, dressed in whitish-grey garb. Another member of GTS?

"Ah, glad you could make it, GTS Officer Lavender..." Vermillion smiled wickedly, despite her damaged hair.

"Aren't we all?" Lavender chuckled. "Now, about burning down that bookstore...when it comes to mage-hunting, we need to be more subtle. Strike when those brats least expect. Allow no one to witness anything!"

"Understood, Lady Lavender..." Chartreuse nodded.

"But how are we supposed to destroy those magic-users without giving ourselves away?" Vermillion inquired.

"Leave everything to me..." A tall, black-haired man dressed in a darker grey suit said, making his way toward the GTS trio.

"And who might you be, sir..?" Lavender asked the man.

"You can call me...Pewter Heart."

Pewter Heart...it couldn't be..!
0553311112.title: The Obligatory "Meanwhile" Chapter

choices: “Your magic is too dangerous for Aria!”
“There’s something you should know about Aria...”
05533111121.content:
After returning to his normal size, Blake sat with Aria on a wooden bench in New Opal Park, thankfully free of persistent crowds and petty criminals. Holding hands, the two took some time to just relax and let the stress of superhuman endeavors just melt away...

“I wish things could be this peaceful forever...” Blake said dreamily.

“So do I...” Aria replied, “...but a superhero’s work is never truly done. In the meantime, let’s just make the most of the time we have — “

“Blake? Is that you over there?” The couple turned to look for whoever spoke. Blake recognized that voice. He hadn’t heard it in years...but somehow it still sounded familiar.

“...Dad?”

The boy jumped from his spot on the bench, running over to hug his father. Aria slowly got up as well, starting to follow her boyfriend.

“Dad...I missed you so much!” Blake felt tears of joy run down his cheeks. “I thought you weren’t coming back...”

“I missed you too, son...” Blake’s father, Pewter Heart, responded.

Finally releasing their embrace, Blake walked back to Aria. “Dad, I’d like you to meet my girlfriend - Aria! Aria, meet my dad!”

Despite her confusion, Aria gave a soft smile. “Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Heart!”

“Likewise,” Pewter replied. “Aria, may I have a moment to speak to my son alone?”

These words caught Aria off-guard. She and Blake were rarely apart ever since he’d confessed his love for her. Now his father chimes in and asks for a private chat with him? But then again, true love required selflessness.

“Alright...” Aria sighed. “Later, Blake...” With that, she walked away, not seeming very cheerful all of a sudden.

“B-bye, Aria...” Blake noticed his girlfriend walk away with her head down, but he couldn’t turn down his father’s request. He and Pewter made their way to the Heart household, sitting in opposite chairs in the living room.

“So, what did you wanna talk about, Dad?” Blake asked, to which Pewter answered...
05533111121.title: Enter Pewter Heart

055331112.content:
Vermillion twitched, scratching her red hair - before catching herself, and resting her glove on the table. She gazed around others seated at the table, to check if anyone had noticed. That guy with the thin nose and earring, making this presentation, was new; a result of GTS' recruitment programs? She'd seen him around the streets before, but he looked different in their blue uniform. Really didn't suit him.

"...Success or failure, these occurrences are still data in this great system." He spoke, with a map of the city - and jabbed a black pin in the spot where the bookstore would be. Others were scattered around, where the sister teams across the table had encountered magic users.

She leaned over in her chair, staring at the ceiling. "These are more than marks on a map, you know. They're training little kids to make a magic army..." She pounded her chest, turning red. "That really hurts me!"

Vermillion felt pressure on her left, making her cringe. She turned to see Chartreuse leaning over in his chair. "It hurt me, too. Right here - and here - and here..." The blond pointed all over his hefty body.

Attacking the map with another pin, the presenter harrumphed. "To paraphrase Sheng-ji Yang: pain is just information. You have the input; now act on it." He waved to another mage hunter seated at the table. "Now, from the IT group?"

"With pleasure." A woman got up, a sleepy look in her eyes, giving a wide smile to the duo. "I've gained the trust of a suspected magician through chat rooms. A rookie, with very little we can squeeze out of her - but she thinks she's speaking to a real master. We needed a lot of data to so perfectly, flawlessly emulate a magician. For that, I must thank the small fries - *ahem* - my ground team associates' unique information gathering mechanisms."

"Thanks! Glad to help!" Chartreuse had to hold his partner back from lunging like a rabid dog.

Vermillion grumbled. Averting her gaze, she looked to a spot on the map where the roughly-scattered marks conjoined. "Huh. I wonder..." Her glove loomed over the city block on the paper. The fingertips brushed each little pin, before the shadow of one index finger blotted out a great building. She smiled, and ground her finger into it.

---

"Over there, right?" Aria tapped the city map. A water ball levitated over her palm. This time, she was a little slow to follow her boyfriend. "Are you sure this is fine? I'm so new to this magic thing. I've never been to a ritual, and there'll be so many other mages."

Blake nodded, patting her on the back. "Hey, you're fine. I know they'll like you." He led her through the alleyways, glancing down at the directions. "And it's quiet here. Nobody will make a big deal if they see you."

"I just feel so strange. I have these powers instantly, that everyone else needed so much practice to get... It doesn't feel fair." Still experimenting with her spells, she glanced wide-eyed at the liquid in her hand. She tapped it, dispelling the enchantment - and splashing both their faces. "Well, I guess I still need some practice!"

Despite himself, Blake laughed. "But you're doing a great thing with it. Nobody's complaining about Glimmer Gal stopping crime!" He patted the uniforms in his backpack, next to the magical focuses and books. "I'm kinda surprised about the designs you made for us, though. Are..." The dark-haired boy rubbed his glasses. "Are disguises really supposed to show so much skin?"

The brunette now sped ahead to get in front of Blake. "Think about the headlines. 'Nobody has seen her face, but everybody has seen her midriff'! But more importantly - it draws attention away from the eyes or face."

"Yeah, but... revealing it on both of our costumes?" He came to the door, knocking four times, pausing for exactly seven seconds, and ringing.

She chuckled. "It turns heads, that's all we need!"

The door creaked open. A man in a dark mask spoke in a strained voice: "I am here to borrow some - no, merde, YOU say that." He closed the door, and re-opened it. "What is your business?"

Blake answered in the code phrase: "We are here to borrow some sugar."

"Come inside."

The teens stared at the paintings in the entrance. They followed their guide down a flight of stairs. Five people sat inside around chalk etchings and scattered materials. A traditional ritual; Blake didn't know much about this one, but he'd used the same rosemary ash his own summoning. Only candles lit the magic circle, as they all chanted quietly. Aria gulped - but her boyfriend's smile made her know they were doing well. The two newcomers walked into the dark basement, making their way into the group and joined hands.

The yellow-clad girl held Blake's palm with her left hand, and a young boy's with her right. He looked up at her, still chanting with the same seriousness the adults were. The black-clad boy had joined hands with a shorter woman in gloves. She glanced to him, blinked in surprise, then instantly looked back to the dust lifting from the floor. The woman started a speech:

"We are gathered today to overcome. To seek out greater things, to surpass what the surface world shows us." With a kick of her boot, the dust floated higher. Blake sucked a bit in, sneezing - making two of the circle's members glare him down. Aria's tender eyes, though, brought his spirits back up. "So the old sects will smile upon us, and..."

Her voice trailed off. The dark-haired boy felt the hand on his right slipping out. His girlfriend had her eyes shut. More dust flew into his nostrils, with a burning odor. The fires on the candles were too bright. Wax melted, dripping onto the floor. His eyes shut, and he felt himself getting heavier...

---

"C-come on! I love you..." That was Aria's voice. "Oh! Oh, thank you!"

A boy's voice: "He's awake. That's all of us."

The world was hazy. Blake rubbed his messy hair, feeling around him. Something cold to the touch, like a bar. That's right - he was in that room for the ritual. After inhaling that dust, he fell asleep. And after he rubbed his eyes, taking in the world around him - he realized where he was.

A cage.

In a small room, devoid of features, he was locked in a small cell - with his bag of spell focuses leaned against the wall. Nine other cages were around the room, with four of them holding people. Aria sat in one across from him, trying her hardest to smile.

"They're anti-magic bars," one girl said. "This is terrible... I got you all trapped!"

Blake recognized them all from the summoning. But - with him and Aria, there were seven people total. That girl he'd held hands with and one other woman were missing. Where were they?

As if on cue, that woman who nearly burned down the bookstore trod through the door. Vermillion stared over the group of trapped mages. They all spoke at once:

"What is this?"

"Help! You can't do this!"

"Do you really think you can-"

She ignored them, walking right towards Blake's cell - and spat in it. "You're lucky my fists don't fit through those bars."

The boy reeled back, then stood up. "Y-you're... with the GTS!"

The redhead nodded - her wig coming loose. In a hurry, she put it back in place. "Yes - we mage hunters organized this ritual. And you're all mage hunter's prey, caught in our trap." She turned to the others, clasping her hands together. "Don't worry, we have a great deprogramming method for completely relieving you of magic influence."

Aria shouted: "Deprogramming? That just means torture!"

Outside, seven knocks. A pause. The doorbell rang. Vermillion slipped a mage costume over her coat, and waved to them. "...You'll get to experience it firsthand, once we have some more of your kind." She shut the door behind her.

Blake tried calling out spells. Flame, quake, flight, shrink - nothing. The bars were really blocking out his abilities. But he couldn't give up - with all these people, and his girlfriend's smile, all on the line.

He had an idea.

"Aria! Try tipping your cage over. Take my bag, it might have something in there!"

She pushed once, then twice - then, with all of her might, slammed into the cage wall. It leaned forward. She grasped onto Blake's backpack, and looked inside. Magic dust, book of spells - there! A spare pair of glasses! She jammed them in the lock, fiddling it around slowly - and managed to set herself free.

Instantly, she rushed to her boyfriend's cell, undoing his lock. He ran out, sharing a brief hug with his savior. Quickly, Blake called out his shrink spell, and jumped into another mage's lock - as Aria undid one more with her makeshift lockpick.

But before they could get far, footsteps rang out on the other end. The GTS members were coming back! Aria quickly called to Blake: "Get in my mouth!"

"What?"

"You'll need to hide, or they'll kill you! And they can just confiscate the bag. So - " She opened her mouth, leaning over to the miniature mage.

Nodding, Blake jumped onto her tongue - the wet surface felt uncomfortable beneath his feet. As she closed her jaw, the world outside disappeared. He could only hear her pulse, racing as she prepared her next move. Blake lay back, hoping it'd only be temporary.

The young woman looked around, trying not to move too much - or the little hero in her mouth could end up gulped down. She kept her jaw a little loose, hoping to give him breathing room. She tried her best to finish unlocking the young boy's cage, but the steps got closer. Her little boyfriend's shivers transferred through her. If only she could close her eyes, and make this a dream...

No, Glimmer Gal had to do something. These people believed in her. She had to be bold, but not panic. Smart, but decisive. As the door opened, Aria...
055331112.title: A Ritual Gone Wrong

0553311122.content:
Aria paused at the door. What if Blake and her couldn't face them alone? What kinds of horrors would GTS subject them to if they didn't make it out?

Then, she heard Blake's voice within her mouth: "Do you think they've caught anyone else in the ritual?" He was feeling a little cramped - and the straight row of teeth blocked his sight. But a small vision spell, and the small flexes in her muscles gave him all the crucial details. Anyways, he trusted his partner. He held on tightly to the closest bit of her tongue's massive, wet surface.

His words made Aria realize: these people in the room weren't the only ones in danger. She shook her head, and answered: "We're not going to let them hurt anyone!"

...She hoped that didn't slosh Blake around too much inside. It had to be hard, moving from one cage to another; but she couldn't leave him behind.

A tall woman grabbed the doorknob, clad in fake mage robes and a smug smile that touched her eyes. "My, Vermillion and Chartreuse are such good prison wardens. Leaving a backpack that could have magic objects lying around, for any captive to grab..." She snickered. "It's a good thing the cunning GTS Information Officer, Lady Lavender, is here to pick up after them. They should thank me for soundproofing the ritual room, too; otherwise, our guests might be hearing some very unpleasant things." She covered a laugh as she pulled back the handle. "I'll reward myself by reappropriating some of these mages' extra supplies for further research..."

As soon as she opened the door, Lavender noticed three things. First: two cages were open. Second: a bag had moved. Third: a young woman stood before her, clad in a glistening mask, an outfit revealing her taut midriff, and a pointing finger. In the time it took the GTS member to register this, she was also registering a solid blow of magic energy to the gut, the sensation of flying backwards through the air, and the wall impacting against her back.

Glimmer Gal had suited up just in time - and in the same spell, Blake changed to his Micro Mage persona. Feeling Aria's slimy muscle brush up against him made him especially uncomfortable by how much skin his outfit revealed. She stood in surprise for a moment again, finger trembling in place. It took a few congratulations from the trapped mages to get them back into reality:

"Way to go!"

"Ooh! I saw you on TV!"

"Thanks!" the younger boy smiled at her.

She smiled back - then felt a tap on the roof of her mouth. The boy inside crawled out on her tongue, eliciting some giggles from her. "Hey - she's moving!"

The officer groaned, stumbling up. Micro Mage signaled his companion - who sprang towards the foe, pinning her against the wall. She focused all her strength in keeping this woman's arms down. "We don't want to hurt you; just help us get them out!" The force in her voice shook him up and down.

Lavender shook her head, holding back giggles with an unnaturally large grin. "Swallow your food before talking, child."

"I said, let them out!" Now, the shout spat her companion right out of her lips. He landed into the woman's chest. Her clothing beneath the robes was rather sparse - making him fall right in the bosom beneath, which gave way easily to his body. He was in shock for a moment. That was the first time he'd heard Aria speak that loudly, even having been shrunken around her for a week. And this spot was far closer to the enemy than he'd ever imagined being.

Betraying her wide smile, both heroes could feel her breaths getting deeper. "Ha, that's one way of clearing your mouth." She noticed Aria's hands warming up with mana. "Tsk tsk! If you cast a spell now, it'll hit your little partner. And if you let go of me, I'll trigger an alarm."

The teeny teen squirmed, blushing like mad. A strong perfume assaulted his nose, like the scent of... what was it? Of course, lavender. He felt like any moment, she could press the buxom mountains together and crush him flat. But something caught his eye: between her shirt's bursting buttons, Aria was still there, glaring down. Her anger was alien, nearly horrifying; but she was protecting him... No, giving him a chance to save the others. With his shoulders bumping against unfamiliar skin, he rubbed both hands, and asked: "Spirits, show me the way to undo the bondage on my fellow mages!"

He shut his eyes. A blurred vision came before the boy, slowly focusing - and making him groan. "...like... seriously, spirits?

Reveling in her foe's anger and bewilderment, the woman tried to move an arm. "Do you really expect me, Lady Lavender, to - GAAAH~!?" A yelp of surprise flew out of her mouth, interrupting her gloating. She looked to her chest, shaking her head. A little shape was moving in there, under her shirt! Her arms quivered, attempting to break from Glimmer Gal's hold. "Oh-ho-ho-ho, that tickles!"

Aria stood still for a moment, hiding her face. It was embarrassing to look at that bulge moving down there, in the villain's clothes. Her mind raced with questions... But when she looked back to see the caged mages, she knew she had to help give him a chance. "Micro Mage! What's happening down there?"

He messaged back: "I found the keys to unlock the cages, just keep holding on!"

Micro Mage felt surrounded, kneaded on all sides by mounds of bulbous flesh and muscle. He scurried through it, nudging the oppressive, silky surfaces aside. With his magical senses, he knew the keys were close, hidden somewhere on this massive body. So he kept facing forward, the spongy floor below bursting into sweat and shivers.

"My!" The word merged with an exaggerated moan. "Is your boyfriend always this upfront with women he's just met?" Her eyes narrowed, cheeks lifting higher.

The teen above shook her head."You're trying to distract me, it won't work! We won't let you kidnap the mages."

The pinned woman moaned out a little harder and longer than was really necessary, her eyes rolling upwards and legs kicking. "Ah~ But this is for your own safety! All sorts of things can go wrong when you misuse their powers..."

The young boy from the side looked over in worry. "Don't - don't say that! I..." He looked at the other people trapped around. What would their fate be?

The volume of Lavender's voice, shaking through her vocal cords, put Blake off balance. He fell face-first into her navel. It took a brief struggle to unglue his head from the crevice. Finally, right near her wide hip, the keys were in sight, dangling by a rope-like chain. He picked them, filling both of his arms, and signaled: "Got them!"

Glimmer Gal grinned, letting out a tense breath. "She's still down, can you get out?"

"Her robes are blocking some of the path. I'll fly out, and over to them!" He felt mana flowing and charging in his hands, which he pushed behind himself, and tilted his head roughly towards the prisoners. "WIND!"

But just as he called the spell out, Lavender made her move. She kicked against the ground, pushing Glimmer Gal back. The mage's relief had weakened her grasp; Aria was taken off-guard. While still holding on, she stumbled to the side. Blake's flight path ended up ramming his face into her bare stomach. Her could feel her yelping in surprise. And the wind spell's gust didn't stop, dragging him further and further across it.

His flight ended up sending him hurdling towards...
0553311122.title: A Step Forward Into Danger

choices: "Are you alright in there? Please hang on!" He was in Aria's belly
"Oh-ho-ho-ho, digest well for me, boy!" He was in Lavender's belly
05533111221.content:
The wind bounced him off both of the titaness' chests, back and forth - like a pinball. He ended up in the air, right above Lavender's wide smile, which just grew wider and wider...

Until it snapped at him.

The GTS officer's jaw closed right around his legs and cape, sucking backwards. She forced herself back into a sitting position. The keys dangled right from his hands. Her gigantic tongue pulled him in, like she was licking a lollipop or slurping spaghetti. The slimy organ tugged back, pushing his waist past her lips.

"Aaaah!" His heart pounded like a drum, slowly drowned out by the wet sloshing behind him. His kicking only seemed to make her hum happily, and return playful jabs and licks with the snakelike muscle. People around broke into gasps and confused murmurs. Blake's tiny arms pushed back against the slick, pink surface - but they slipped unevenly. They couldn't compare to the sheer strength of Lavender's giggling mouth.

Aria gulped. She couldn't let go, or her foe would escape - but Blake was right there, getting sucked into their enemy's smug smile! If only she'd pushed back harder! Now her boyfriend would be gobbled up - again - along with the keys...

...The keys! She shouted: "Micro Mage, use those keys as a lasso with my mouth!" She held her jaw open, saliva dripping from the roof.

Blake took a second to overcome the rushing terror. He swung the chain in a circle. The suction behind his stomach turn, but he could still aim well. The keys landed right on his girlfriend's great tongue. She started sucking back on it, making the chain bridge the gap between both titanic mouths. Blake grabbed on and tugged himself forward, trying to climb out.

Lavender's long neck twisted and turned away. Glimmer Gal did the same, trying to wrestle it away. Dizzied by the slurps, which wobbled the wire, Micro Mage maneuvered forward - eyeing the bright face at the end of the rope.

The GTS officer tried tickling him with the slimy muscle to make him let go, lathering around his legs. A bold gulp from Aria, and a strong push from Blake's arms, brought him closer to his goal. His girlfriend's giant lips soon surrounded his head once more. It was like a soothing kiss.

But the dark-haired woman didn't relent; without warning, her own immense tongue dove deep into Aria's mouth. The latter blushed, trying to push back. Pink muscle from both titans surrounded Blake on either side, covering his face in moisture.

"Mph-mph!" Aria mumbled indignant cries.

"Mmmh~" Lavender cooed out.

They wrestled over the little boy, tossing him back and forth. He was slammed into the woman's gigantic white molars. They pressed down, getting a firm hold on him that removed the wind from his lungs - until Aria's mouth sucked back, sending him shooting towards the roof of her mouth. As it tried to keep him in place, her tongue ground the minuscule teen against the roof of the mouth. Lavender's pink monster hungrily brushed against him, prodding, nudging, trying to break the hold. Presently, it curled around the chain holding the key, and tugged back - pulling him into her jaws completely.

Aria had her eyes shut, just relying on her sense of touch to fight back. She resisted urges to draw back in embarrassment, forcing herself with deep breaths to keep a hold on Blake... and her lunch. The interior of her opponent's mouth felt wide, slick with gross liquid, and way too active. Every miniature giggle and snicker wobbled through the throat and shook the jaw, sending vibrations through the girl's tongue. She felt dread when imagining how much they shook Blake - poor Blake, nobody deserved this! It was probably rattling his bones, terrifying him to the core!

Lavender felt another vicious jab from her opponent's mouth. As long as their lips were locked, and their arms were locked - Glimmer Gal was helpless. She only had to stall for time, and those dim minions from the ground team would come to her aid. Despite their lack of prison guard skills, there were a few little things she could depend on Vermillion and Chartreuse for help with. Protection. Arson. Death traps. Re-education. Beer runs. Income tax. Grief counseling.

Glimmer Gal, Micro Mage... to think, she'd see them so soon. They didn't hide their fears well at all; but they were good at overcoming them. Did they even know about GTS' higher-level structure? Every lick from her and enticing wiggle from him fed more information. She tilted the boy around in her mouth, rubbing his facial features deep into the taste buds. Her eyes stared right into the girl, and felt her heartbeat. Lavender remembered that face. Just like her little sister, in the times before. Before those mages came...

The woman smirked, and swallowed hard.

Blake was nearly sucked in completely down the throat. He saw the uvula dangling above him, and emerald stomach acids down a nearly-endless muscular tunnel below. But the chain was still in his hands, still pulling back. He gripped hard, gritting his teeth, and dragged himself up. The back of the monstrous tongue brushed against his partly-exposed chest, sending swampy warm liquid down it. But he climbed still, guided by a dim light that shone off her teeth - and ended back up. Instantly, a tongue pushed down on him, planting his face in a pool of saliva. He was slowly, stickily, dragged back into the oral fray.

Twisting lips transferred the boy back and forth between jaws, neither of the girls ready to relent. The GTS officer kept twirling him around; pushing him in dangerous positions; hoping to prolong the torture until her companions' return. The magic-struck heroine tried breaking the stalemate with a definitive yank. She opened wider, and slowed down her sloshing, trying to give her minuscule partner room to breathe. But she could feel him and the keys sliding right out, unable to match her opponent's pull. Any hesitation could mean losing him. So, she went back in with increased determination, her hands clenched around the arms.

He endured it all - twists, turns, an entire war within a pair of glistening caves. All he could do was hold on, squirm away from gaping throats, and keep holding onto the mages' keys. Any spells he cast might hurt Aria's mouth, and give Lavender victory...

...Come to think of it, which of them was Aria's mouth? He'd been tossed back and forth so many times, he lost track. It was hard to tell which of the great, overpowering tongues was which when both great muscles sandwiched him and squeezed him thoroughly.

At last, having been thoroughly sucked, squeezed, and tickled; after every part of him dripped with one girl's spit or his own sweat; he squirmed the wrong way, right down a throat. Endless organic surfaces flew past him as he was tossed towards one of the giant uvulas. The other tongue dove in after him, but ended just short of him, sending spittle in his direction. Blake reached out helplessly, letting out a scream that echoed off the white teeth, lost in thick layers of flesh, bone, and muscle.

Micro Mage couldn't tell if it was his heart throbbing, or his swallower's. Way back, his teacher taught him deep breathing techniques for stress. Trying them now, the boy just inhaled more musty air.

He and the keys plunged down helplessly through contracting throat walls, which masticated his teensy frame, squashing his limbs against one another. Wet squelches sounded around, each shaking him to the core - simply from the subconscious, unremarkable act of swallowing. Nobody outside would even tell he was more than a lump passing gently down someone's neck.

A valve of muscle pushed below him. He gasped as it slowly gave way beneath his trembling legs, sending putrid gas bubbled from below. Unable to keep his footing, he gripped for the walls - the soft surface gave way easily between his fingers, but it was too wet and smooth to hold onto. He fell right in, plummeting into the stomach.

A deep pool of churning acids greeted him, splashing around his costume-clad chest. A piece of half-digested food splashed against him. He paddled wildly, trying to make his way up above the waves. As soon as Blake's head made it out, he panted madly, tasting the murky air. A sickly-sweet aftertaste attacked him. He looked around the meaty walls, a few of which merged into relatively dry spots.

"Alright," he gulped, rubbing his hair free of the digestive liquids. "Take it easy, Micro Mage. You've been in a belly before. Your powers protected you. Well, the curse did, really - and you got the shrink spell later - but it works out to be the same, r-right?" A strange itching took his legs. He forced himself to ignore it. Groans echoed in the wobbly chamber, making him tremble. "You just gotta swim over to the safe zone, and - wait."

He looked at his palm. "The keys!"

The chain had plunged deeper, and whirlpools of acid were dragging it away. He dove in after them, not daring to open his eyes in the liquid - just tapping the floor with both hands. He felt like the currents pulled him, too, rising up in mighty tides. By the dull whacks outside, booming below, and the shifting gravity, the boy could tell the giantesses outside were fighting. He pressed forward, knowing that the keys could still save the mages caught outside... At last, he touched a thin bit of metal. His hand drew back in surprise, then in again, chasing it down. There it was! He got a hold of it, and pulled the chain to his chest.

Blake rose up to a dry spot, and lifted the key into the air in triumph. He smiled for a moment, before snorting and choking out the gross acids he'd taken in. Degrading, for sure - but anything to save the people. He patted the wall, resting in it. Soon, the little mage felt a finger poking back at him, pushing into his back.

Right - whose stomach was this? In the clash of titanic tongues, he'd lost track which muscle belonged to which woman. It was just as he wondered this, though, that a voice boomed from above, answering his question...
05533111221.title: Tug of Vore

choices: A new threat from another mage?
055331112211.content:
Aria's voice echoed amid the cacophonous sloshing, the crashing waves of stomach acid. It was a small reassurance - but a reassurance, nevertheless. Blake had landed in the bowels of his gorgeous girlfriend, someone who cared for him and could help him out. Even without a solid way to escape from her digestive movements, it was better than being held captive in Lavender's gigantic gut. The miniaturized hero rested his head against the towering pink stomach wall, catching a long breath of the thin air. A bit of green liquid sloshed against his costume's shoe, and the keys. "You can do it... Glimmer Gal."

The heroine tossed her opponent back, sweat dripping down behind her mask. She felt her exposed midriff in horror, poking a finger into it. Was that her imagination - or did she felt the slightest bit of pressure back? Her stomach groaned, making her cringe. What did that sound like to her boyfriend, deep inside?

Her eyes snapped back to the snickering woman before her, who tossed her robes to the floor. "Ohoho, what was that? You couldn't control your appetite?" The Information Officer shook her head slowly. "Well, the Group for Total Security thanks you for your contribution. I'll update our databases with Micro Mage's current status: mush in his former partner's tummy."

With no hesitation, Glimmer Gal launched another lighting bolt towards the woman. Lavender sidestepped it, and delivered a hook right into the girl's stomach. It shook Blake, sending him flying across the squishy room - and right into another barrier of the stomach tissue. The strength made the seas shake below him, but he kept a hold on the keys.

Aria noticed a wall behind her, where entrapped mages looked on in shock. She stuck her boot out and pushed off it, ramming right into her opponent's torso headfirst. It knocked her opponent back to the ground. "Don't try and gloat! Micro Mage isn't with you, so I won't hold back anymore!" She stepped over and delivered a flurry of punches towards her opponent.

In succession, they hit - until the woman grabbed her by the arms once again, stopping the assault. Her narrow eyes stared into Aria's. "Is he in here?" She jabbed her knee right into the girl, knocking the wind from the superhero. "I think I feel him! Hellooooo!" Her knee ground brutally against Glimmer Gal's belly, digging in.

Blake tried to stay calm amid the churning seas sweeping over him. He switched quickly between flying in gassy stomach air, and being plunged into opaque water or heaps of partly-digested mush. From the small yelps around him, he knew his girlfriend was in trouble. If only he could get out and help. He tried climbing the walls, but the smooth, liquid-coated surface made his hands slip. The boy groaned, splashing into water again with a new blow. "Spider-Man made this look so easy."

The heartbeat around him was uneven, and sped up quickly. Blake shut his eyes to the stinging acids, wishing there was some way, any way at all, that he could rejoin Glimmer Gal in combat. But for now, he just had to hold his breath, as more goop that was once his friend's meal flew into his face. He repeated: "I believe in you!"

Outside, the superhero jumped off the ground. Both her legs kicked out against Lavender's stomach. Her leg power, and the sudden shock, overcame Lavender's arms. The woman glared as Aria slipped back, getting her feet steady once again. Cheers from the captured mages encouraged her - she focused on them, casting aside her fears.

"Water!"

She cast a wave spell behind her, the liquid jets propelling her towards her enemy. The latter pulled off a spectacular leap, flipping through the air and onto the other side of the girl altogether. She landed firm onto the wet ground as Aria slammed against the wall, holding her hands out to block the impact. The woman's face was lit up, chuckles still emerging from her mouth. "Ohohoho, I could cast a better spell than that." She prepared to dive forward.

Without even looking, Aria shouted "thunder!", and flung a bold back from her waist. It fell right at Lavender's feet, which swept aside. Instantly, the wet floor lit into a field of sparks, sending a harsh shockwave through the GTS member's spine. She lept in the air with a jolt, and came back down with her eyes off-kilter.

"Ahaha... Oh, ohoho..." Her laughter continued, fading out as her eyes glazed over.

Blake smiled from within the depths of the gut. The shaking was less severe; now, it felt more like a beach's waves washing over him. Did they win? Yes; he knew it. Even if he didn't do much, a smile still crept on his face. Logically, he should be paddling over to the dry spot again. But for now, the sounds of his girlfriend's pulse slowing down made him feel heavy and slow. He could just lie back and let the waves carry him where they wanted to. After all, he trusted her. They were lovers now. He could just sink into her expanse for a moment, and trust that she'd know what to do. The storm had passed. The liquid's sting was more like a tingle, then like a soft massage. The corners of Micro Mage's brain screaming at him to get up and back into action slowly sunk into the impenetrable depths, as he felt himself rocked by the pulsating, muscular mass, and the footsteps below...

But his fingers still gripped the key. They needed it.

One after one, Aria unlocked the cages. It was harder, just using makeshift lock-picking tools rather than the keys. And after Blake went through so much trouble to get them... But the smile from the young boy as she freed him made her briefly forget his plight.

"Thank you, Glimmer Gal!" He waved up.

She patted his back. That was it - the last cage open. "It's okay. Our secret identity's safe with you, right?"

The boy nodded back. "Let me help you! My spells aren't super-good, but..."

"The important thing is that you're safe. And besides, we don't know what GTS can do with you if you don't have a secret identity." Aria pointed to the large door, where the other mages were already escaping. "We'll handle the rest for now, okay?"

He eyed her stomach. "Is Micro Mage gonna..."

"Don't worry!" Her eyes shut, as her hands gently pushed him to the door. If she said it out loud, she thought she might believe herself. They'd reached victory, but at such a huge cost... Were the two of them really cut out to be heroes?

Aria didn't know if any more mages were being held. She ran through the halls, trying to find the villains. But the house felt larger than when she entered - the directions didn't make sense. Finally, the ritual room was right ahead of her. She entered inside... and felt something cold strike her shoulders. Electricity ran through her spine, sending her to the ground in small spasms. Blake's body crashed against her gut. Gazing up at the dull ceiling lights, Chartreuse stood above her, peering down with a sheepish grin.

Next to him, Vermillion sprinkled the floor with motor oil: "Can't leave any evidence. Restrain her."

"Alley-oop." He bowed down, lifting Aria as she blacked out.

***

Blake stirred. Something was too still about Aria. Her breathing was still resonating in the background, but far quieter. The footsteps below didn't shake his body. A small sensation told him to rest back in the liquid again, relax after his hard work - but no, the warm waters were TOO warm now. Aria's body temperature was rising; and Blake, within her, felt a good deal of that washing over him. The key was still in his hand. Good. He pushed his other down, and murmured: "wind..."

A small bubble erupted from the green waters, splashing over his dark hair. He groaned, and repeated: "Wind."

Another splash, no bigger than the last. He focused all his strength in each arm. Stumbling upwards, Blake stood in the calm sea of Aria's stomach, all his senses kicking back in at once. One solid burst, and he could fly out - he hoped. He pointed down, and yelled: "Wind!"

Nothing came out. However, from his sloshing, a greater bubble formed around the hero, surrounding him. He stood as still as possible as the thing floated upwards, through Aria's gullet. Slowly, a shape came into view in the air: her uvula. Blake took a great leap of faith out, over the gums and past the lips...

...And into the frying pan.

The whole building was blazing in a mass of flames. He gulped in smoke-tainted air. GTS was burning the whole building down. The heroes were both stuck inside an anti-magic cage. Aria sat limp, tied in ropes.

Blake swung the keys towards one of the bars, letting its weight carry him forward. He quickly jammed it into the lock, pulling the door open. "Water!" his attempts at quelling the flames were for naught; they just made the blazes larger.

"Oh gosh, oh gosh..." He ran back to Aria, and - with the key as a blade - cut through the ropes binding her. The boy shouted into the unconscious girl's ear, trying to stir her back up. With no response, and no idea what to expect, he went to her mouth, and planted a small kiss into the pink lips. If this was the end, then...

"Uh... UH!" She darted up, eyes snapping open suddenly. Her brown hair darted back and forth at the embers. She jumped out, and shouted: "WIND!"

Blake joined her: "Water!"

Together, their spell came out as a wet foam. Creaking sounds resonated around, like the foundation was breaking apart. With a few more called spells, Micro Mage and Glimmer Gal spread the liquid around the room. The flames were completely extinguished.

"Hah..." Blake felt himself expanding to normal size again. Everything ached. He fell forward into Aria's arms; she rested her head against him, also panting.

She smiled back. "We... I got the captives out, but you - saved me."

He shook his head. "Way to go. You did great."

With no threats nearby, they lay down together, hand in hand.

055332.title: Bug Out

choices: stay put as Jade enters the basement to look for her you
0553321.content:
"Another day..." you sigh, "...another failed potion."

You've been in your house's basement, trying to become more handsome for your crush, Aria, through magical elixirs, but so far nothing has worked. However, eyeing a lone green concoction, you begin to feel a new spark of hope. Surely this compound will allow you to win her heart! Drinking the potion hastily, you suddenly begin to feel a strange tingle throughout your body.

And then you start shrinking...and turning black...and sprouting wings!

Initially a little dazed from this rapid process, you look in a nearby mirror and are horrified by the reflection: you've been turned into a tiny fly! Stupid potion! Despite your initial urge to panic, you manage to keep calm. Buzzing around the room and searching for some form of antidote, you wind up empty-handed...although, flies don't have hands...do they?

The spellbook! You suddenly remember that you'd left your spellbook in your bedroom! There has to be a spell in there that can restore you to human form. Now it's just a matter of getting there safely...

Do you dare fly straight upstairs and risk being mistaken for a pest by your sister Jade? Or will you fly out the open window and seek out a safer means of getting to the book?
