1.content:
Blake walked down the steps into the secret basement. He switched off the lights and lit candles, illuminating the dark room. He carried a box down into the dark depths and set them on the floor. He arranged them in the way the book had taught him. "Rosemary ash, silken sash. Tooth of man with a devious plan. Silver sage and a torn page! With these items that are here, bring me spirits and bring them here!" The candles went out ... and a dark fog filled the room. Then from the center of the arrangement, an aqua type glow shined. The light grew faintly as three disembodied spirits rose; one short and round, another tall and slim, and the final one, seeming like a normal human being. The short one spoke first

"You again?! Come on kid whadda want?!"

"Hush Esmerelda! We were summoned so we must provide counsel " Spoke the tall one "But I do wonder why this one has summoned us... again... I mean.. seriously where do you get the stuff to summon us?"

"Old baby teeth from my sister and I. Nothing special." Blake explained. The slender one simply huffed and rolled her eyes. The modest one looked on at Blake.

"I assume this is about Aria, is it not." Blake always like this one, mainly because she was nice and helpful while the other two bickered. He nodded and she sighed. "Blake.. you must really learn to speak to her on your own. You cannot rely on the spirits for-

"So what do you want kid? I was in the middle of watching my favorite show" Blake taken aback by that responded with

"You... watch tv?"

"Of course honey, all the time. At my old house, this couple moved in and they fixed up the place. They got this box and play interactive movies or just let them play out. I think its called a 'piss four' " Blake acknowledged what the spirit was saying and chuckled softly

"Its um... actually call P.S. Four. It stands for Play Station." The short one rolled her eyes

"Chil' I think I know what I am talking about. Hush. So do you need our service or what"

"Well yeah.. I wanted to impress Aria." The modest one spoke once again

"As I was telling you Blake you don't have to-"

"You'll need to be better." The tall one spoke. "More tougher, more resistant to pain and strong to lift your two times!" The tall one snarked.

"If that's what she wants then yes" The modest one growled.

"Blake, are you even listening to me? You have to speak to Aria yourself."

"I will.... I just need to be stronger before I can" The modest one sighed then growled.

"Fine, if you refuse to listen to reason have it your way. I will grant you the strength you seek, but it will come at a cost."

"Anything! So long as it gets me close to Aria, I'll take it." The modest one raised her spiritual brow.

"Is that truly what you want?" Blake nodded. The two spirits laughed silently. The modest one's glow no longer was blue.. instead, it had turned a pinkish red... deepening to become more maroon. She chanted what Blake could only assume was the language of the mages... He felt himself rising up. Thoughts finally filled his mind of being close to Aria, her falling in love with him at first sight. He smiled and closed his eyes.

"- with these words said and the path sworn. An ant he becomes, a man no more." Blake's eyes shoot open as he hears this.

"What? I said make me stronger not smaller!" The modest one sighed

"You agreed to the deal my friend. Now... where was I? Oh yes. Let him have the strength of 100 men, the speed of a horse and bones of steel. For it is love that will make this curse unveil. Let him find his lover true for if he doesn't, it'll be his doom...." Blake wanted to protest against that last part, ask them questions, but it was too late. their glow was becoming brighter and brighter until he had to close his eyes. He felt a surge jolt through his body and he felt himself collapse onto the cold hard floor. The surge... had knocked Blake unconscious.

It was some time before Blake woke up. Steadily he rubbed his head. Blake was sure he was seeing things. Everything was at least 20x bigger. Side effect of the spell... or .. curse? He rubbed his head some more before he heard a bell ringing far above him. He winced at the sound. Always loud... just.. like the one at school. Blake blinked to try and clear his eyes. His vision returned to him... and it confirmed what he had feared. The spirits had indeed shrunk him. He was no more than an inch or two in height! Blake started to panic, nervous. What would happen to him? Would he be crushed? Would he find Aria? How would he eat? Where would he sleep?! All these questions raced through his head until.. he saw her...

"...In my mouth!"

The bespectacled shrinkee blinked curiously, looking over the looming hillocks of the face before him. It wasn't like his friend - no, girlfriend - to make jokes like that.

Aria looked down at her chest, putting a hand to it. "My chest worked out in a dark theater, but here, you'd be a little obvious... I'd really have to push you deeper for my parents to avoid you, and..." She shook her head. "Y-you could just... Just fall right... right... I mean, I might've gotten a bit sweaty there, so..."

The little guy in her hands tried to laugh it off. "Yeah, I understand! I don't have to go back in." Realizing he might've been rude, he corrected himself: "I didn't mind it, of course, but - b-but, I mean..." His eyes bugged a little when he heard that slipping out of his tiny throat so easily. Now, they were both blushing, stumbling over their words. The movie's goofy atmosphere had pulled them together closer than they thought possible - in more ways than one. But with the credits done, they were back in the real world, trying to maneuver around their own bodies and avoid trouble from above.

The brunette's soft palm trembled a little bit as Blake lay his diminutive back into it. She brought her lips jarringly close to him. Last time he went in, she had no time to think, and just popped him into the honey-scented cave. But now, he got a close-up view. Soft ridges crossed each peachy cushion, looking glossy and velvety. If he stared long enough at their minuscule movements with her concerned breaths, he could picture himself just falling into them, lost forever...

He glanced away, still not totally comfortable with his own thoughts. "How about your purse?"

She was so close, he could feel the exhales and inhales as she spoke. "I... I don't want you to be cold again."

That little hesitation... Did she just want to feel her boyfriend in an embrace again? His mind rushed. He tried to still his beating heart, sure that Aria could feel it against the supple skin of her hand. Turning his head back to the wonderful face before him, he stumbled back - then forward, gulping. "Sure. Yes. I can go in again."

The giant face before him smiled. That's all he really needed to regain himself. Those beautiful lips parted, revealing a cave before him. Her tongue, mighty yet supple to the touch, inched out like a carpet onto the folds of her fingers. Obediently, almost in a trance-like state, Blake stepped forward onto it, letting the pink muscle sink around him. It felt like an embrace itself, only... wetter. And it went up to his ankles.

She pulled it in. His arms instinctively wrapped around it for support. He stayed clutched to it when he finally entered, and watched all traces of sunlight disappear into a progressively thinner bar of light formed by the even rows of her teeth. They closed with a sharp SNAP! He simply rested into the cushion formed by his lover's tongue, surprised at his own eagerness. The footsteps sounded out below, walking down a path.

He tried tossing and turning a few times, looking for the best way to remain comfortable. It wasn't hard; just resting back in, his body felt like it was soaking inside a sweet, warm sauna. His fidgets tickled the young woman a few times at first, making her jaw shake; she had to hold herself to avoid revealing anything to passerby. But she got used to it quickly, after feeling him move over the flexible muscle a few times.

Finally, they stopped. He heard a door opening.

"Welcome home!" A man's voice came out first. "How was the movie?"

She shrugged, humming a little. Her tongue pushed Blake aside for a second, moving him as carefully as possible to her cheek. It still felt rough, though, as the boy was pushed into the rosy surface within her. "Hi dad! It was pretty funny. A little on-the-head when it came to some parts, but I like that sometimes."

Her passenger quietly nodded in agreement. They shared such similar tastes, it was magical... Feeling brave, he hugged her cheek from the inside, which made her chuckle gently. He felt her pressing a hand to his spot. Now, a woman's voice rang out, no doubt the household's maternal figure: "I'm glad you went, even when you couldn't find anyone else."

She thought for a moment, judging the safety of her comment before speaking up. "Blake joined me for it. He had fun with it, too."

Her mother answered: "Oh, that's even better! He's so quiet, I'm glad you brought him out of his shell."

There was a little pause. Blake felt saliva pooling around his body, and had to move to prevent from getting drenched - but not so much that it would irritate his friend, or cause an involuntary swallowing movement. A deep chasm rested nearby, and who knows if he could escape it? He stilled his trembling, using the mouth's muscles for support.

The man finally spoke up again. "Yes." His tone wasn't angry, but... a touch dry. Forced.

Blake moved a bit when Aria answered: "I'm sorry for not telling you, but... He's so nice, I wanted to do something..."

The voice, dripping with sugar, calmed the tiny boy. It relaxed him, even as he felt harsh wind blowing through his hair; liquid all over his legs; pulsations through his chest; and intense pressure from the silence outside.

"Fernando, you can't be angry about that." Her mother had a slightly louder tone now. Or was Aria just getting closer. He still felt movement below, and noises like shoes hitting wood - drowned out slightly by the noise of her heartbeats.

The man outside sighed. "Carol, I didn't want to say anything, but... I've been a teenager before." The high school girl gulped, but her tongue carefully prevented her boyfriend from falling back. He continued: "A nice, quiet teenager. Easy to influence. And I hid a lot from my friends."

"Ahah, I hid a lot too - I was just worse at it!" The mother chimed in. Aria's soft giggled felt like a vibrating chair massage against Blake's body.

"Blake just reminds me too much of myself back in the day. I always shrunk away from responsibilities." Hearing this, the boy slid down a little - and felt himself jump up. Was that just Aria taking a seat? It felt like a massive quake. He hit the roof of her mouth, and felt back comfortably onto her tongue. What were they discussing?

"Dad, don't say things like that! You're both great, but you're different people." She pressed the boy in question under her tongue now. He felt a couple of bumps, and the sense of gravity shifted - she'd leaned towards her father to give a large hug. The echoing words still seemed to bounce around her white teeth.

Her mother added: "After all, it's not just about him, it's about the movie! Did they end up together? No, don't tell me, I want to find out for myself... But, was the other person a nice guy, or...?"

They chattered on for a moment, sharing details. Blake felt odd during the whole scenario, just getting peeks of the house of his girlfriend. It was like he was a burglar, having to hide from the view of the other people - but also, listening to their interactions from a distance. He wanted to add in his own comments at some points, but... Maybe that would be for another day.

What was more surprising was Aria's reactions. She was blushing like crazy earlier, but didn't show any awkwardness here. Every one of her movements perfectly hid the uninvited guest. Her tongue patted him a little in between sentences, to move him to safety, or just as a soft caress.

With the brief conversation over, one of them spoke up.
111111111211.title: Stealth Mission in Girlfriend's Mouth

choices: Patience has never been one of Blake's strengths, what's the harm in exploring?
No, Blake will stay put. In fact, he can hear someone coming now...
1111111112111.content:
"May I go to my room for a moment? I'll be back." Aria asked calmly. She wasn't in any rush, but because of how long Blake had been sitting in her mouth she was starting to salivate, and she didn't want to accidentally drown him in saliva.

"Of course, go ahead sweetie. We'll have dinner shortly, so please come down for that if you're still in your room when it's ready." Carol said. Aria nodded, which shook Blake around a little underneath her tongue, and quickly headed out of the room.

"Don't worry, I won't be five minutes, promise." Aria said, smiling as she quickly made her way up the stairs and to her bedroom. Once she was out of sight of her parents, Aria carefully opened her mouth, and searched for her tiny boyfriend with two fingers.

"Sorry about that, I should have found a chance to get you out earlier..." Aria apologized quickly, blushing at how thick her saliva covered Blake, "I won't have a chance to wash you up just yet either, so I hope you're not feeling too icky."

"It's fine, your mouth was surprisingly comfortable!" Blake said, which got a cute chuckle from Aria. "I take it I'm not invited to dinner? Something tells me your parents might not approve if I turned up unannounced, given my...current condition."

"No, I think you'll have to skip on dinner. It'd be safer if you didn't come, there's a little too much risk of you winding up on my plate... I'll grab you a snack though, so you don't go hungry." Aria explained, now entering her bedroom. It was a rather quaint and well organized, as you'd expect from an intelligent girl like Aria. Books neatly lined shelves that dotted the walls, which where covered in muted dark green and brown wallpaper, which gave the impression of being inside a dimly lit forest.

Blake was placed gently on Aria's desk, and she pulled open a drawer before quickly stuffing it with a few tissues.
"Jump in, please?" Aria asked, indicating to the drawer. Blake shrugged, and did as she asked. The tissue clung to his sticky form, but it did help clean him off a little bit.

"Do I have to stay here till you come back?" Blake asked, a little disheartened, "I was hoping to spend more time with you..."

"I'm sorry, yeah you do. I can't have you wandering off, especially if someone else finds you before me. I'll try to be quick, I promise."

With that, Aria carefully closed the drawer, sealing Blake in almost complete darkness. She left it open a crack, so that he'd be able to breathe, but not much else. Satisfied, Aria turned around, and quickly made her way back downstairs for dinner.



After about half an hour, Blake was getting restless. He knew Aria would take a little while, but it was rather hard to wait someone he was madly in love with, especially when he had nothing to distract him with in the meantime. Frustrated, Blake stuck his hands into the crack above him, and wiggled them around. The drawer budged, ever so slightly, and Blake realized he'd be able to climb out with a few more tries.
But...Aria told him not to. He was impatient, sure, but he didn't want to go against her wishes. Especially if it ended up putting him in big trouble.
1111111112111.title: Hiding Aria's little guest

choices: Blake agrees to make out with Aria
11111111121112.content:
Blushing a bit, Blake decided to stop wiggling the drawer around - he wouldn’t want to disobey his giantess girlfriend and end up in a whole heap of trouble. In fact, he could hear her gentle footsteps approaching right now...

Aria, satisfied with her dinner, smiled as she entered her bedroom with a piece of white bread in her hand. She carefully opened her tissue-stuffed drawer, much to the delight of her tiny boyfriend.

“Hey there, little man!” Aria cooed, lowering the bread down enough for Blake to climb onto it. “I know it’s not much, but...”

“I-it’s alright...” Blake replied. “Thank you, Aria!”

He nibbled on the bread, smiling as he began to take bigger bites (which were still rather small compared to those of a normal-sized person). Apparently Aria was a brilliant chef - the bread was delicious! In little time at all, Blake had completely consumed the bread slice and now sat atop Aria’s palm.

“So, did you enjoy your snack?” Aria asked with a soft smile.

“It was amazing, thanks!” Blake smiled right back, overjoyed at getting to spend more time with the love of his life.

The tiny mage was caught off-guard when Aria set him atop her dresser, approached her bedroom door, and locked it. She made her way back to him...and started to remove her yellow shirt! Blake’s blush turned even redder as his girlfriend took off her golden skirt, leaving her clad only in her orange bra and panties.

“So, Blake...” Aria spoke seductively. “You wanna make out?”

Blake definitely wanted to blurt out and say “yes” to Aria’s offer, but he was too nervous to speak up. This was his first time to be offered sex, and the shrunken boy wasn’t used to seeing a girl dressed like this in front of him.

(Chapter originally by Moby mick)

Aria looked down at her tiny friend with a growing blush on her cheeks. "Oh Blake, you're such a little cutie~ You're a very sweet boy and I'm glad you told me this. Truth be told, part of me was suspicious you might have had feelings for me for awhile now~ I think it's even better that you're so adorable at this size~ It takes alot of courage to confess to your crush when you're so small." She cooed out, bringing Blake up and planting a soft kiss on top of his head. The warm pillows cushioning Blake before being pulled back into the beautiful gaze of Aria’s eyes.

"I know the others might think it's strange dating someone this small. But I think the size of someone's heart speaks much more than the size of their body." Blake was stunned, slowly looking back up as his heart raced. "D-does that mean...?"

"Yes Blake, I'll go out with you~" she giggled, nuzzling the tiny mage into her cheek. Blake hugged back as quick as he could. "A-aria, you have no idea how long I've waited to say that!! I-i can't believe this is really happening!"

Aria’s fingers rustled his little hair as she giggled. "You're adorable, Blake Heart~ So is there some magic spell that's got to be broken to turn you back to normal size, or do you get to be my pocket size boyfriend for the rest of our days?"

Blake was about to answer his love interest’s question when suddenly a magical surge coursed through his body. The spirits’ spell was wearing off! As he steadily grew back to normal size, the mage slipped from Aria’s hold, but miraculously he was able to cast levitation magic, preventing him from painfully impacting the floor. By the time he adjusted his position and stopped floating, Blake was regular size once again.

As the final bell rang, Blake and Aria took each other by the hand and happily exited the school building, looking forward to a wonderful, loving relationship.

11122.content:
"Now, " the teacher flipped skillfully through the book, "we're going to read out a few lines from Act 1, Scene 5. Do I have a volunteer for the Nurse?"

Blake glanced around from his warm, cozy hiding spot. To be between his love's breasts, unseen by the world... It felt wonderful, but a bit taboo. Around the vast expanse of the classroom, not a single figure moved. He could hear, behind the soft blankets of fabric, Aria's breathing pattern change slightly. Her shoulder, petite but larger than his whole tiny body, shook a little.

He recognized that twitch. She wanted to go up. The mage nudged her slightly, trying not to touch her chest too much. When she didn't take notice, he prodded the mound with his shoulder. It quivered like an animal shaking a fly off. The vibrations resonated through his hand, and down his spine, followed by a flustered mew. She glanced down, blushing. His stomach turned at that expression; how could someone able to hold him in her hand look so helpless?

"Come," the instructor scanned the class. "We can't all play Juliet."

He gathered his courage and spoke to the immense beauty surrounding him: "Do you want to play as her?"

She shrugged back, a sigh escaping her windpipe - like a cool breeze through chimes. He couldn't help but sink deeper into that mass of cleavage. "Yes, but... I wouldn't want to draw attention to you."

"Aria!" Ms. Solar picked her out. The schoolgirl's soft eyes moved gently from Blake's breast-bound body to the teacher's index finger. The beautiful girl kept her head bowed. "You don't have to be shy. Come to the front! Now tell me, what is yond gentleman?"

She nodded quickly, and trotted to the chalkboard, book clutched between her delicate fingers. The whole time, she tried to balance the speed of her footsteps so as not to jostle the shrunken boy. Her right hand hovered in front of her shapely bosom. Blake could only see the world beyond her torso from thin stands of light letting their way through her digits. The class remained indifferent, only a few faces not staring at the clock or out in space.

The brunette glanced over her booklet, making mental note of the lines as she breathed in. "The son and heir of old Tiberio."
The magician had no clear view of his holder's face; still, he could feel something change. The music in her tones gained a quieter, subtle nuance that shivered down his torso. It quivered with pity and concern at the end. She didn't get the name correct, but the emotion that she put in it more than made up for it. For a minute, he was no longer in his class, or in his dream girl's chest; but in medieval Italy through Renaissance eyes, in a feud between families.

"Good! Let's keep that up. For the part of Juliet, any volunteers?" The teacher scanned the room, half-lulled to sleep. Rude. Blake felt like casting a curse on them for not listening. At the very least, he thought, they wouldn't be paying much attention if he revealed himself. A low-pitched mumble slid across the stagnant air from the seats in the back. The voice's ring was familiar, even as a distant wind. Almost as if by reflex, Ms. Solar pointed in its direction and declared: "Nora! Thank you for volunteering!"

The mage's face went pale. The bully he'd feared even at normal size... Now stomping to his spot, murmuring bitterly, gripping her copy of Romeo and Juliet with enough strength to crush a building. What's worse, he knew Ms. Solar would react when this horror of a teen girl gave too much sass. This display of strength that shook him to the core was Nora holding back. He sunk deeper into the chest that held him, his squirms making her giggle a little - though she tried to control herself.

Her legs' unprovoked assault on the floor tiles ended when she was next to the brown-haired girl keeping hold of Blake. The two shared a quick gaze - he still couldn't see his love's face, but even Nora's features seemed a touch calmer when looking at her. He could practically feel her breath against him as she went blurted the lines in one mouthful: "What's he that now is going out of door?"

Surprisingly, her pronunciation was perfect. And she didn't need to look at the book, unlike Aria. Almost as if she'd read this before. But at the same time, it came out in a dry, single tone; as if the bully didn't know what inflection the characters would use, or what they were feeling. Or, more likely, just didn't care.

Suddenly, the eyes in the distance twitched down. The shrunken boy froze. Nora blinked; then squinted; then, her eyes widened; finally, they burned, piercing into him. Like a full solar eclipse, smoldering flames light-years away with a featureless black pit in the center. And they both pointed right at him.

Aria let out a quick gulp. More than a few eyes pointed at the two. Her hand rose higher; only barely clouding Blake's view of the towering actress opposite her. With an exaggerated turn on her heel, the amber-clad titan continued the recitation: "Marry, that, I think, be young Petrucio."

Again, what music! What grace! That sweet echo from her lips combined with her natural empathy and quick understanding. It gave this character, whose name he did not know thirty minutes ago, a distinct voice and personality. And to be so close to her... The tiny teen felt ashamed to have forced her up in this situation. He was falling in love with her all over again; and could see himself falling deeper into her grasp with each new tune that slid from her tongue. All this, from just these quick passages.

The mage's vision was now parallel with the classroom door. Still, he could hear his old tormentor's voice growing louder behind him - then, to his side. "What's he that follows there, that would not dance?". By the end of the recitation - its monotony only broken by higher-pitched, aggressive emphasis on the last question - she stood before him in all her glory, or lack thereof.

With a muted gasp, Aria drew back. The hand before Blake's body quivered slightly, but held firm. "I-I-I know not." He nudged it, trying to hide behind the smooth flesh, or deeper into the pillow-like expanse behind him.

Nora only came closer, like a beast about to leap on its prey. Her voice became slower, placing unnatural power in each syllable. "Go ask his name: if he be married. My grave is like to be my wedding bed." She let out a sly chuckle, like she understood what she was saying. Her own fingers slid out, rubbing the bottom of her lip.

It was almost like watching an old-fashioned joust - with his knight rapidly losing ground. But what was the opponent trying for, anyway? With any class members not bored out of their minds gazing up, this bully couldn't just reach into a classmate's shirt... Could she?

Aria countered: "His name is Romeo, and a Montague; The only son of your great enemy." She coughed slightly, sending another quake down the little boy's body. She was so cold, and the yellow shirt's surface so smooth, it felt like he could just slide down and disappear...

The fire-eyed girl turned so her back was opposite the class. She spoke again, barely looking at the book: "My only love sprung from my only hate! Too early seen unknown, and known too late! Prodigious birth of love it is to me, that I must love a loathed enemy."

Suddenly, her palm came flying at Aria's makeshift shield of a hand, slapping it aside - and with it, sending Blake tumbling to the ground. Both girls' clothes whirred by in a blinding mix of warm colours. He reached up helplessly to their silent faces, growing more and more distant. Though the floor approached, he didn't dare to look down...

In a blunt thud, he reached his destination. He heard a few voices murmuring in shock, or sympathy; but none of them seemed anything more than a distant dream to the miles of tiles around him, and the twitching ankles on either end of his diminished body.
Aria took notice instantly. Her eyes sparkled, and her soft lips dropped in compassion. She fidgeted for a second, pretending to hesitate on a line. Then, with one quick burst, her legs fell out of her dress, and she dropped to the ground melodramatically. Even having just been between her breasts, the floor-bound boy couldn't help but blush. This was closer to her creamy thighs than he'd ever dreamed of being. She looked up with that same little pout, and cried: "What's this? what's this?" Not exactly fitting for the scene, but it served to hide her real actions. The whole time, her left hand grabbed around on the floor to scoop him up. With a second to regain his breath, he ran back for it...

...And met with Nora's shoe slamming on him. "A rhyme I learn'd even now, of one I danced withal." Everywhere, it stung - the dirt accumulated at the base of her sole hurt his eyes, the grinding pressure she exerted from above tortured his limbs, the terrible performance of Shakespeare above tormented his ears. He reached his hand out for Aria, holding his breath, hoping she could save him from the same gruesome fate of the lovers who defied the stars...

"Alright, that's enough. Very well done, both of you!" He could barely hear Ms. Solar's declaration from that distance. Of course, she was just being polite - but it lifted his spirits slightly. Surely, this would save his skin, if not his romance's dainty fingers...

"Thank you Blake. I promise to get you out soon. Thank you for this! You'll be out before you know it~" Blake sighs and hopes she keeps her word.

Aria heard something on her shoulder. She felt tiny feet bearing down on the cloth. And moving. Her first, instinctive reaction was to shudder. To her, it was a small, barely perceptible thing. To Blake, however, it seemed as though there was a massive earthquake. He was unable to keep his balance on the shifting surface of his giant friend's yellow shirt. And so, the young mage fell down off her shoulder... and into her bra.

Aria turned her head to look at her shoulder, but it was too late. She missed seeing Blake topple into her cleavage. And so she simply shrugged, deciding she'd imagined the "bug" on her shoulder, and went back to whatever it was that she was doing. The tiny mage, however, was inundated, drowning in a sea of warm flesh. Aria's massive breasts slammed together at the slightest provocation. Even tiny movements caused the walls to collide and sandwich Blake between them. But the mage slowly began to climb his way out of the enormous chest of his love interest, and made it to the edge of the bra when Aria made it to her seat.

Aria made her way to her seat in the classroom, completely unaware that her movements were causing tiny Blake to lose his balance. Without sufficient time to run off of the seat, Blake felt the impact of Aria's butt on the entirety of his small frame. The girl thought she'd heard tiny screams...but quickly dismissed such silly ideas, turning her full attention to the task of preparing for class.

Blake wasn't sure if he felt like he was in heaven or hell. He was close to Aria, the girl of his dreams...but being rendered helpless under her ass wasn't exactly what he'd had in mind. Although it didn't hurt physically, the tiny mage was rendered nearly helpless by the force of his crush's posterior weighing his whole body down onto the seat. 114212.content:
Indigo returns from the restroom and sits down. She sighs softly as she pulls out her favorite book, the tale of "Isshunboshi." She flips to her bookmarker and picks up her fork digging in a bit into her chicken salad. Her eyes pry at the novel and she begins to eat her lunch, digging into the salad while reading, visualizing the scenes playing out before her. She had read the novel many times prior and was currently on the scene while the shrunken warrior Isshunboshi attempts to get the attention of the princess, however, he is unable to and she accidentally hurts in the process. 'How could someone be so careless,' Indigo thought to herself. She sighed and carried on reading, carrying another piece of food into her mouth. Just then however she hears someone call her name. It was faint but she could definitely hear it. She looks away from her book, looking left and right. but not seeing anyone. Indigo shrugs it off as her imagination and goes back to reading continuing on with her lunch. As lunch continues and Indigo finishes her meal she feels a bit of chicken still left on her tongue. Bored she toys and rolls it around her mouth, sucking off all the flavor it had while she read. She'd swallow it down soon enough. Once she deemed that morsel had lost its flavor she moved it to the back of her mouth and swallowed... She pauses for a moment and looks to her belly. How odd... she almost thought she felt it move... oh well... must have been her tongue or a stray piece or something. Indigo goes back to reading and smiles enthusiastically.

"Indigo! Indigo!" Blake shouts. He jumps and waves his arms around to get his classmate's attention. Indigo sits down and sighs and pulls out her book from her pack. I have to get her attention and get back to Aria... Blake muses to himself. Blake then sees Indigo lift her hand above him and reach to the side of the container the salad is in. She lifts her hand up and digs it into the leafy floor. The jab causing Blake to yelps and falls over into the food. He looks up and sees that she is holding a fork that had just pierced the salad he was on. He looks around and realizes the situation he's in. Crap.. if I don't hurry and get her attention I'm going to be...

Chomp!!

her lunch... Blake watches as Indigo chews into the food and readies her fork to strike again, all while she reads her book. Blake fruitlessly tries to shout out to her, calling her name, but to no avail. She keeps eating unaware of the shrunken boy afraid for his life. He realizes he cannot get her attention however and starts to make his way over to her. She sighs above him, drawing his attention. Blake looks up and sees her fork coming right for him! He yelps and covers himself to avoid the sharp fork and is thrown to the leafy floor again. He feels the ground under him lift and move. Blake pries his head up from the ground and sees he has been scooped up with Indigo's next bite! Blake's eyes widen and he tries one last time to shout and call out her name, desperately wanting- no, needing to be noticed!

"INDIGO!" Blake calls out a final time and everything stops. Blake shuts his eyes and prepares for the worst.. but it never comes. He feels Indigo's warm breath coat him from her nose and looks up see her looking... for something... She must have heard him! Blake smiles and goes to call out again but Indigo shrugs, causing the mage to lose his focus and brace himself on the fork again. He's lost his chance. Indigo opens up her mouth and Blake is quickly shown the warm, wet and slimy interior that is his classmate's mouth. He blushes as her warm humid breath quickly washes against his face. He wipes off the condensed saliva off of his face just in time to be fully inserted inside her maw. Blake scrambles backward but her lips close, sealing him in darkness. Next, her fork pulls out from under him, causing him to fall yet again onto the floor this time it is a mix of chicken, leaves and Indigo's fleshy pink tongue. The muscle under him springs to life as she moves the food towards her teeth Blake yelps and avoids being pushed as Indigo begins to chew, her ivory teeth gnawing and tearing away the meat and fibers. Spit soaks Blake and forces him to stick more to her tongue, he hugs the muscle, doing his best to avoid getting chewed up. Luckily he manages to avoid being chewed only to have the mush rest on top of him. Indigo slides the mush towards her throat and Blake calls out again, hoping Indigo would hear him. His only response is a simple tongue movement and a resounding.

GULP

The tube of muscle squeezes Blake down towards his classmate's unassuming belly. He is pulled down for seven long seconds before being deposited in Indigo's massive gut. Blake, along with the rest of the meal rest in the fleshy chamber awaiting digestion. Blake throws the food off of him and goes to the nearest wall and begins wailing on it.

"INDIGO! HELP! You swallowed me whole! Get me out!" His cries go unanswered until a sound echos above him. He looks up and sees more food deposited into the chamber that was his friend's stomach. He looked around and saw mashed up greens and chewed bits of tan chicken all completely unrecognizable had he not known before. Indigo's stomach juices pool near the bottom and start to break down what is present. In this dire situation, Blake thinks on what to do.
